claim: 3D image of Lord Rama was displayed on Burj Khalifa in Dubai.
fact: There are no news articles on the internet about displaying Lord Rama's image on Burj Khalifa. The original photo of the viral photo is available on stock photo websites like Shutterstock and Adobe Stock. In this, there is no projection of Lord Rama on Burj Khalifa. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Chandrababu Naidu entered Ayodhya temple wearing shoes and participated in worship programs without wearing a tilak - Way2News news article.
fact: This news was not published by 'Way2News'. This is a photo edited with false article using their logo. Way2News organization clarified this through an X post. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video message sent by Italian Prime Minister Georgia Meloni in support of Hindus before the Ram temple consecration ceremony in Ayodhya.
fact: Georgia Meloni shared the viral video on her X (Twitter) on January 15, 2024. In this video, Meloni thanked people for sending birthday wishes and messages. No reports were received that Meloni sent a message to Hindus on the occasion of Ram temple consecration ceremony. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Video of Lord Rama's images displayed on the clock tower in Srinagar.
fact: The display of Lord Rama's image seen in this video took place in Dehradun. In the context of Ram temple consecration in Ayodhya, images of Lord Rama were displayed through laser light on the clock tower in Dehradun. News articles reported these scenes. However, there are no reports that Lord Rama's images were displayed on the clock tower in Srinagar. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Video of a Rama devotee traveling to Ayodhya on his hands for Lord Rama's idol consecration ceremony.
fact: The person appearing in the viral video is Nihal Singh (alias Bichu Bam) from Bihar. He is traveling from Devghar to Basukinath as part of his pilgrimage to visit various Shiva temples by walking on his hands. He started this journey on July 4, 2023, in Sultanganj, Bihar. Moreover, speaking to us on the phone, he clarified that he is not walking to Ayodhya on his hands, he is walking on his hands to Basukinath temple, and it may take another month to reach there. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: President of India Draupadi Murmu was not invited to the consecration ceremony of Lord Rama to be held at Ayodhya Ram temple on January 22, 2024.
fact: VHP President Alok Kumar, temple construction committee chairman Nripendra Mishra, and RSS leader Ram Lal handed over the invitation letter to President Draupadi Murmu on January 12, 2024, to attend the consecration ceremony of Lord Rama in Ayodhya. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: An elderly woman who keeps shoes safe at a temple in Mathura donated Rs 51 lakhs for the construction of Sri Ram temple dharamshala in Ayodhya.
fact: No reports were received that the elderly woman mentioned in the viral post donated for temple dharamshala construction in Ayodhya. However, reports were received that this same woman donated Rs 40 lakhs in 2017 to conduct worship to Sri Krishna at Banke Bihari temple, and to build a goshala and dharamshala in Brindavan, with money received by selling her property and guarding devotees' shoes at the temple in Mathura. Therefore, this claim is misleading.

claim: The central government has clarified that Aadhaar can now be considered as proof of date of birth.
fact: The circular issued by UIDAI stating not to consider Aadhaar as proof of date of birth was misunderstood. UIDAI clearly stated that Aadhaar should be considered only as identity proof and address proof, not as date of birth proof. Many courts have previously reiterated the same. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Balakrishna commented that Nara Lokesh is the real successor of Senior NTR - Way2News news article.
fact: This news was not published by 'Way2News'. This is a photo edited with false article using their logo. Way2News organization clarified this through an X post. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The British government declared January 22, 2024, as a holiday on the occasion of the Ram temple consecration ceremony in Ayodhya.
fact: Britain did not declare the Ram temple consecration day as a holiday. There are no reports that the British government declared a holiday. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: The Kerala government will shut down electricity supply throughout the state on that day to prevent people from watching the Ram temple consecration ceremony in Ayodhya.
fact: KSEB stated that the news that the Kerala government is undertaking a maintenance program for electricity supply throughout the state to prevent people from watching the Ram temple consecration ceremony in Ayodhya is not true. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: The Ram temple is being built not at the site of the demolished Babri Masjid in Ayodhya, but about three kilometers away from it.
fact: Currently, the Ram temple construction in Ayodhya is taking place at the same site where the Babri Masjid was demolished. This is evident from satellite photos. The media also confirms the same. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Modi pushed India 40 years back in his four-year tenure - Raghuram Rajan.
fact: Although there have been instances where Raghuram Rajan made critical observations on Modi government's economic policies, there are no reports that Raghuram Rajan made the viral comments. These fabricated comments are being wrongly shared as attributed to Rajan. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: The Gujarat government has ordered schools there to make students say Jai Shri Ram instead of Present Sir during roll call.
fact: No evidence was found that the Gujarat government ordered schools there to say Jai Shri Ram instead of Present Sir during roll call. No information related to this matter was available on the Gujarat government education department website. However, since 2019, the Gujarat education department issued a circular making it mandatory for students to say 'Jai Hind' or 'Jai Bharat' instead of 'Yes Sir' or 'Yes Madam' during roll call in all schools. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Scenes of Muslims attacking Hindus celebrating Sankranti festival in Harinagar under Borabanda limits in Hyderabad.
fact: On examining the FIR filed by the police, the complainant did not anywhere complain that he was attacked on religious grounds. Moreover, among those mentioned as accused in the FIR, along with Muslims (Abbas, Imran), there are also Hindus (Rahul, Jai, Nikhil, others). From this, it is understood that this was just a quarrel between youth belonging to two groups. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Scenes of Shiv Pratishthan activists attacking NCP leader Jitendra Awhad who recently made controversial remarks on Lord Rama.
fact: No media reports were received that Jitendra Awhad was attacked after making controversial remarks on Lord Rama. The currently viral attack scenes are related to the attack on him in Sangli, Maharashtra, in protest against objectionable remarks made by Jitendra Awhad about Babasaheb Purandare. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Video of a crab eating bread in a boiling pot.
fact: This is an edited video using two different videos. The original video of a crab eating a piece of bread has been on the internet since at least September 2023, showing a crab eating bread on rocks resembling black pebbles. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: If there is another birth, I want to be born like AP CM YS Jagan - Director V.V. Vinayak.
fact: In an interview, director V.V. Vinayak referring to Puri Jagannadh said 'If there is another birth, I want to be born like Jagan', and these comments are being wrongly attributed to AP CM YS Jagan in the context of current political situations. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Photo of RSS workers celebrating by burning the national flag on Gandhi death anniversary.
fact: This photo is digitally morphed. The photo of Shiv Sena workers setting the Pakistan flag on fire in protest against terrorist attacks in 2015 was digitally morphed and the Indian flag was placed in place of the Pakistan flag. Moreover, this photo has no connection to Gandhi death anniversary. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: The person in this video is someone who resembles actor Shobhan Babu.
fact: This video is a shoot video of a Swiss model named Kevin Lutolf. It has been edited using deep fake technology. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Andhra Pradesh surpassed Kerala to stand at the top in the country in terms of Access To Education.
fact: According to the 'State of Foundational Literacy and Numeracy in India' report released by the Prime Minister's Economic Advisory Council for 2021 and 2023, Andhra Pradesh did not stand at the top in the country in terms of Access To Education. Only in 2021, it was ahead of Kerala. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Way2News graphic stating that TDP president Nara Chandrababu Naidu made inappropriate comments on women police saying 'What do women police know about vote registration?... Women easily succumb to bribes'.
fact: Way2News Fact-check said through their 'X' handle that this viral graphic being shared on social media as if reported in Way2News is fake, and that false information is being spread using the Way2News logo. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of a two anna coin with lotus symbol issued by the British government in 1616.
fact: There is no evidence that the British government minted a coin with lotus symbol. The British first obtained permission from Mughal Emperor Farukhsiyar in 1717 to mint coins and started minting English pattern coins in Mumbai. However, officially, the British government minted coins from 1835. That means, there is no possibility that the British government minted this coin in 1616. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Prime Minister Narendra Modi distributing Ram temple consecration invitation letters door-to-door in Ayodhya.
fact: This video is related to the occasion when Modi recently visited the house of Meera, a woman who is a beneficiary of Ujjwala scheme (10 crore beneficiary) in Ayodhya. However, there are no reports that Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Trust/Modi invited all houses in Ayodhya. According to news articles, it was learned that the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Trust invited 80 prominent persons from various fields in the city to attend this program. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Video of 'Jatayu' team arriving in Ayodhya to attend Lord Rama's idol installation ceremony in Ayodhya.
fact: This video has been shared on social media since 2021. However, it is not known when and where this video was taken. However, it has nothing to do with the currently ongoing Ram temple consecration program in Ayodhya. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: CM Revanth Reddy's effigies burned in protest against his comments on YSR's death - Way2News
fact: Although it is true that Revanth Reddy made comments on YSR's death in the past, there are no reports that Revanth Reddy made comments on YSR's death after becoming Chief Minister. However, the Way2News news clip currently being shared is not real. It has been digitally edited. Way2News also clarified that they did not publish this clip. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Screenshot of a tweet by Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu apologizing to Indians for the comments made by his ministers on Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently.
fact: Maldives President Mohamed Muizzu did not apologize to Indians in the tweet. The last tweet from his official 'X' handle was posted on January 5, 2024, which is not a tweet apologizing to Indians. Some online tools that monitor posting activity of social media accounts indicate this tweet as his last tweet at the time of writing this fact-check. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A person named Yamin Khan in Mathura, Uttar Pradesh, loved a young woman, raped and killed her when she was alone.
fact: The photo shared in the post is of the young woman's body found in a suitcase on Yamuna Expressway near Mathura. It belongs to the young woman who was honor killed by her father in Delhi on November 17, 2022. The same was announced by Mathura police by organizing a press conference on November 21, 2022. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Rahul Gandhi said that if he is made Prime Minister, he will make the sun rise in the west instead of the east.
fact: Rahul Gandhi made these comments referring to Narendra Modi at an election campaign meeting held in Chhattisgarh in 2018. Rahul Gandhi commented that Modi says 'if you make me Prime Minister, I will make the sun rise in the west instead of the east', and that he speaks such words. However, by removing the comments made in this speech referring to Modi, only the 'changing the direction of the sun' comments are being shared as attributed to Rahul Gandhi. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: From January 5, 2024, overloaded vehicles will be fined Rs. 20,000.
fact: The provision of fining vehicles traveling with overload has been in force from before, this is not a newly implemented provision. There are many incidents of fines imposed under this provision across the country. The central or state governments have not announced that they are implementing this provision specifically from January 5, 2024. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Maharashtra government has approved implementation of Old Pension Scheme (OPS) for all government employees.
fact: Maharashtra government has not approved implementation of Old Pension Scheme (OPS) for all government employees. It has only approved implementation for 26,000 employees who were appointed in job notifications issued before November 2005 and received joining letters after November 2005. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: 95,040 ration cards were cancelled in Medchal district.
fact: Civil Supplies Minister Uttam Kumar Reddy clarified that their government has not cancelled even a single ration card in the state so far. News articles published the same statistics regarding ration cards cancelled in Medchal district in 2016. From this, it can be understood that information related to ration cards cancelled in Medchal district in the past is being shared again now. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Eating ginger immediately after a heart attack will reduce the heart attack.
fact: According to research articles published on the National Library of Medicine and WebMD websites, ginger works effectively in protecting heart health. However, there is no evidence to say that taking ginger immediately after a heart attack will reduce the heart attack. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: These in the photo are the idols of Sita and Rama that are going to be consecrated in Ayodhya Ram temple.
fact: The sculptures of Sita and Rama being shared on social media were posted by Arun on his social media in 2019. Arun's wife clarified that the sculpture of Rama to be installed in Ayodhya will look like a five-year-old boy. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Legal punishment will be imposed under various IPC sections even if there are obstructions/attacks on Telangana employees' performance of duties - State government Chief Secretary warning.
fact: This circular being shared in the name of Telangana government Chief Secretary is fake. The government Chief Secretary did not issue this circular. The Telangana government clarified the same. However, these IPC sections are already in force across the country, and if anyone obstructs a government employee's performance of duties, they are punishable under these sections. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Photo of Haj pilgrims traveling comfortably using facilities arranged by the Kerala government.
fact: This photo shared with the intention that the Kerala government made comfortable arrangements for Haj pilgrims is related to Bangladeshi Haj pilgrims. News articles there have been using the same photo regarding Haj pilgrimage for the past few years. However, recently many criticisms came that the Kerala government failed to provide minimum facilities to Ayyappa devotees at Sabarimala. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: TDP former MLA Chintamaneni Prabhakar tied a Dalit woman to a pole and beat her for drinking water near the borewell in his field.
fact: There are no news articles that Chintamaneni Prabhakar tied a Dalit woman to a pole and attacked her. The photo related to the incident of a son attacking his mother in Odisha recently is being shared as attributed that Chintamaneni Prabhakar attacked a Dalit woman. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: YCP MLA Katasani Ramireddy who fell and got injured while playing cricket as part of 'Aadudam Andhra' tournament.
fact: The person who fell down uncontrollably while playing cricket in the video is Odisha BJD MLA Bhupinder Singh. This incident happened on December 25, 2023, while inaugurating cricket competitions in Kalahandi district. This is not an incident that happened in 'Aadudam Andhra' tournament. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A person who time-traveled from a parallel universe was arrested by officials at Tokyo airport in Japan in 1954.
fact: Many news organizations reported that a person was caught trying to deceive officials at Tokyo airport in Japan in 1959 as if he came from a country called Taured that doesn't exist in the world so far. It was learned that a person named John Allen Zegrus created a fake passport as if he belonged to a country called Taured and traveled to many countries, and when he came to Japan with his Korean wife, officials at Tokyo airport interrogated and arrested him. A Tokyo judge sentenced John Allen Zegrus to one year in prison on the charge of illegally entering their country. The propaganda being shared that this person came to Japan by time traveling from a parallel world is completely false. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The governments of both Telugu states declared holidays for educational institutions in the context of Corona cases.
fact: Currently, the Telugu state governments have not declared holidays for educational institutions in the context of increasing Corona cases. The video currently being shared is from 2020 when TV9 reported that holidays were declared for educational institutions in view of the Corona impact at that time. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Courts of various states ruled against Shirdi Sai Trust in cases related to inappropriate comments made by Swaroopanand Saraswati and his followers on Shirdi Sai.
fact: In the hearing on the same matter in Hyderabad City Civil Court, as the defendants did not appear, the court ordered Swaroopanand Saraswati and his followers in favor of Shirdi Sai Trust not to make inappropriate comments on Shirdi Sai in the future. Similarly, Swaroopanand Saraswati apologized for his comments before the Madhya Pradesh High Court Indore Bench on the same matter. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Giorgia Meloni recently commented that there are compatibility problems between Islam and Europe.
fact: Giorgia Meloni made these comments in 2018, before becoming Italy's Prime Minister. Speaking in an interview in 2018, Giorgia Meloni commented that Islam is not compatible with Europe's values and civilization. Giorgia Meloni recently commented that their government failed in controlling illegal immigration. However, it was not reported anywhere that Giorgia Meloni recently commented again that Islam has a compatibility problem with Europe. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Indian government arrested 500 people from Qatar in retaliation for Qatar imposing death sentence on eight former Indian Navy officers.
fact: Although the news that DGGI conducted raids on airlines including Saudi, Qatar Airways, etc., in October 2023 with allegations that these companies are evading taxes contrary to GST law is true, there is no truth in the news that 500 people from Qatar were arrested regarding these raids. The Ministry of Finance stated in a statement that 500 people were arrested in connection with cases involving GST evasion of Rs 57,000 crores during the period April 2020 - September 2023, and linking this with raids conducted on Qatar companies is leading to these news being shared on social media. But actually, these are two different news. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Indian mathematician Ramanujan first discovered that the number 2520 is divisible by all digits from one to ten in mathematics.
fact: The number divisible by all digits from one to ten can be found through Least Common Multiple (LCM). Based on the concept of Least Common Multiple discovered centuries ago, it can be calculated that the number divisible by each digit from one to ten is 2520. There is no evidence to say that Ramanujan first discovered this or that dates in the Hindu calendar were formulated based on the number 2520. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Prashant Kishore stated that TDP has no chance of winning the upcoming 2024 elections.
fact: This news was not published by 'Way2News'. Way2News organization clarified through an X post that this is a photo edited with false article using their logo. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Andhra Pradesh minister Roja saying that YS Jagan Mohan Reddy should not become Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister again.
fact: This is an edited video. She said in her speech that Pawan Kalyan made these comments in the past saying that YS Jagan should not become Chief Minister. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Santiago Flight-513 disappeared in Germany in 1954 and landed in Brazil after 35 years in 1989.
fact: There are no news articles or official records that the missing Santiago Flight-513 returned after 35 years. There is also no evidence that there was actually an airline named Santiago Airlines. The first to publish that Santiago flight disappeared and appeared after 35 years was an American print-based tabloid called Weekly World News (WWN) in 1989. However, this organization published many such fictional articles. Many news organizations reported that this organization gained fame in publishing fictional articles. Therefore, what is said through this post is false.

claim: We say many things to win the election, now we cannot give, because there is no money - Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.
fact: This is a digitally edited video. Siddaramaiah did not make these comments while talking about Congress's promises, he attributed these comments to former Karnataka Chief Minister Yediyurappa. Recently, in the Karnataka Assembly, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, while talking about the implementation of election promises, recalled that when Yediyurappa was asked about loan waiver in the past, he said 'Do we have a printing machine? Where should we get money from? We can say anything before elections. Can we follow whatever we said then?' Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Congress, which went to court saying not to link Aadhaar card to schemes earlier, now wants Aadhaar for free bus travel.
fact: Telangana Congress government has not made Aadhaar mandatory for free bus travel. The provision that any identity card should be shown to travel free bus was wrongly understood as the government linking this scheme with Aadhaar. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: If Jagan loses in the 2024 Andhra Pradesh elections, there will be no welfare schemes - Loksatta party leader Jayaprakash Narayan.
fact: Loksatta party leader Dr. Jayaprakash Narayan did not make these comments. There is no evidence anywhere that he made these comments. His office clarified the same to us via email. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Photo of Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajan Lal Sharma traveling hanging on the footboard of a bus like a common man.
fact: This is a photo taken during the occasion when police arrested and transported Bhajan Lal Sharma, who participated in a protest program organized by BJP against the Congress government in Jaipur in August 2023. Bhajan Lal Sharma shared photos related to this protest on social media. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Narendra Modi gave a message to the people of the country not to buy foreign goods for 90 days.
fact: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called on the people of the country to show interest in buying indigenous goods on various occasions in the past through 'Mann Ki Baat' and other media. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and central ministers clarified that they are promoting indigenous products with the aim of making India self-reliant, not against any country. Narendra Modi did not say that if people don't buy foreign goods for 90 days, India will become the second richest country in the world, or that Indian currency will become equal to one dollar for two rupees. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Mehbooba Mufti married her father's younger brother (i.e., paternal uncle).
fact: Mehbooba Mufti married Javed Iqbal Shah, who is her maternal uncle's son, in 1984. Mehbooba Mufti divorced Javed Iqbal Shah and is currently living separately. Javed Iqbal Shah's father is Mehbooba Mufti's father Mufti Mohammad Sayeed's maternal uncle. From this, it is clear that Javed Iqbal Shah is Mehbooba Mufti's maternal cousin. Mehbooba Mufti did not marry her father's younger brother as stated in the post. Therefore, what is said in the post is misleading.

claim: Scenes of the newly constructed Ram temple in Ayodhya.
fact: This post shared a 3D video of Ayodhya Ram temple created by a designer named Rohit Shukla. A YouTube channel called Shivaji Home Design published this video in November 2021. What is shown in this video is not the actual Ram temple built in Ayodhya. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Teenmar Mallanna commented that if he is not given MLC post, he will topple the Congress government - 'Shanarti Telangana' newspaper article.
fact: 'Shanarti Telangana' did not publish the article in the photo shared in the post. Shanarti Telangana editor Teenmar Mallanna clarified through Facebook post and YouTube live that this news article going viral on social media in their name is fake. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: This is a photo of Prime Minister Modi having lunch with Ram temple construction workers.
fact: This photo is from December 2021 when Prime Minister Modi had lunch with Kashi Vishwanath Dham project workers in Varanasi. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy issued orders that children of government employees should study in government schools, otherwise there will be no promotions and increments.
fact: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy did not issue any orders that children of government employees should study in government schools. In 2022, this same fake post went viral in the name of UP CM Yogi Adityanath. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Through Enforcement Directorate (ED) raids, the previous UPA government recovered only Rs. 4,156 crores of black money in their ten-year period, while the NDA government has recovered Rs. 1,22,731 crores of black money from 2014 till now.
fact: According to information given by the government in Rajya Sabha, the total value of assets attached by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) from 2004-05 to 2013-14 is Rs. 5346.16 crores, and from 2014 to October 2023, ED attached assets worth Rs. 1,16,792 crores. However, not all attached assets are black money. They remain under ED custody only until the trial is completed in court. After the trial is completed in court, if the court determines that money laundering crime has occurred, it orders the confiscation of that property. Thus, the total value of assets confiscated from 2014 to October 2023 is Rs 16,637.21 crores. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: The person speaking in the photo is SFI worker Manoranjan who recently threw a smoke bomb in Parliament sessions.
fact: The person in this photo is SFI Mysore district president Vijay Kumar. The image shared in the viral post was posted on SFI Mysore Facebook page on September 8, 2022, during the SFI second conference held in Mysore. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Police took a young Ayyappa devotee into custody at Sabarimala.
fact: This video shows scenes of a boy pleading with a police officer to find and bring his father who went missing in the Nilakkal area of Sabarimala. In the full video, immediately after this incident, the boy's father came to the bus and met him. From the Kerala Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) logo being on the bus, it is clear that the boy was sitting in a Kerala government bus, not in a police van. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Noodles are made using pig bones.
fact: The video shared in the post shows part of the manufacturing process of beef masala packets given with noodles in 'The Gourmet Artisan Ramen' products made by the 'Harim' industry in South Korea. Noodles are generally made using wheat flour, good water, etc., with the help of modern machinery. No news organization has ever reported that industries use pork meat in the noodle manufacturing process. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Information related to documents required for the Mahalakshmi scheme to be implemented by Telangana government.
fact: After the Congress government came to power in Telangana, as part of the Mahalakshmi scheme among the six guarantees announced by that party in the election manifesto, only free bus facility for women has been implemented so far. Currently, the government has not yet taken any decision (as of December 13, 2023) regarding providing Rs.2500 per month to women and gas cylinders for Rs.500. The Chief Minister and Cabinet clarified that they will implement the remaining ones of the six guarantees in 100 days. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: BJP committed EVM irregularities in the recent Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Chhattisgarh state elections.
fact: This news clip is related to the EVM malfunction that arose during the mock test conducted during the 2017 by-election for Ater constituency in Madhya Pradesh state. The Election Commission resolved this issue then. No such incident was reported in the recently held five state elections. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: The Jumma Palli Mosque in Ramanathapuram district in Tamil Nadu was once a Hindu temple. But now Muslims are using it as a mosque with the support of the local government.
fact: The Jumma Palli Mosque in Ramanathapuram district in Tamil Nadu is one of the oldest mosques. It is built of stone in Dravidian style with Islamic sentiments. In 'The Hindu' article, they explained the features of this mosque in the book 'Islamic Architecture in Tamil Nadu' published by the Director of Museums, Government Museum Chennai. It is believed to be one of the oldest mosques in the world. They stated that it was originally built by Yemeni traders in 628-630 CE and was completely rebuilt again in the 18th century. There is no evidence to say that it was built on an ancient temple. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Scenes of two women quarreling in a bus after Telangana government provided free bus travel facility to women.
fact: Kannada media organizations reported in July 2023 that this incident took place in a KSRTC bus. Moreover, Telangana government provided free bus travel facility to women only from December 9, 2023. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: This video shows tornado scenes in Chennai.
fact: A video showing similar visuals was published on Shutterstock website with the title 'Hurricane damage in coastal town'. No tornado scenes appear in this original video. However, the same video was edited and posted by a YouTube channel named @rtsarovvideo to make it appear as if there was a tornado. This is not a real tornado video and has no connection to Chennai. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: When Revanth Reddy was taking oath at LB Stadium, TDP leaders held yellow flags and created commotion, and Congress workers beat them, as published by 'Way2News'.
fact: This news was not published by 'Way2News'. Way2News organization informed through X post that this is a photo edited with false article using their logo. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The person in this video is a candidate who won in the 2023 Rajasthan Assembly elections, and he was shot dead by miscreants.
fact: The person who died in this video is Rashtriya Rajput Karni Sena President Sukhdev Singh Gogamedi. On December 5, 2023, Sukhdev Singh was murdered at his residence in Shyamnagar, Jaipur city. However, as stated in the post, Sukhdev Singh Gogamedi did not win as an MLA in the 2023 Rajasthan Assembly elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: In the recently held Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections, BJP secured seats in multiples of 56.
fact: According to Election Commission of India information, in the recently concluded Assembly elections, BJP won by securing 54 seats in Chhattisgarh, 115 seats in Rajasthan, and 163 seats in Madhya Pradesh. In none of these three states did BJP get seats in multiples of 56. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Picture of KTR's wife Shailima crying while holding KCR after BRS defeat in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections.
fact: This photo shows KCR consoling Shailima after going to Haranathrao's house after Shailima's father Haranathrao's death in December 2022. Another photo shows KTR consoling his wife who was crying in emotion after her father died. These photos were not taken after the 2023 Telangana Assembly election results. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Udayanidhi Stalin commented that the people of Telangana have hindered Telangana's development by defeating KCR.
fact: Udayanidhi Stalin did not recently make any such comments related to the 2023 Telangana Assembly election results or related to KCR. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Central Election Commission recently withdrew the national party recognition status that Bharat Rashtra Samithi had.
fact: The Central Election Commission has not given national party status to BRS party till now. The BRS party has not achieved any of the qualifications prescribed by the Election Commission to obtain national party recognition till now. This NTV news video reported that the Central Election Commission withdrew the state party status that the BRS (formerly TRS) party had in Andhra Pradesh in April 2023. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A tampered Electronic Voting Machine (EVM) was used in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections.
fact: This is an edited video. In the first part of the video, there is a Goshamahal constituency voting machine, but when the camera pans to the left and shows the vote recorded in the VVPAT, that part is from a video uploaded by an Instagram user named Saroj Khedekar. This is a video taken by someone voting in Madhya Pradesh's Bharwa constituency, and the VVPAT part of this video was cut and added to the video of a voter voting for the BRS candidate on the Goshamahal voting machine to edit this viral video. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Scenes of Kapilathirdham waterfall in Tirupati overflowing with floodwater due to Migzam cyclone impact.
fact: This video shows scenes of heavy floodwater entering Kapilathirdham waterfall in Tirupati in November 2021. This video is old and not related to the current Migzam cyclone. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Fishes washed ashore at Vishakha beach due to Migzam cyclone.
fact: This video was taken in May 2023 when hundreds of fishes came to the shore with the waves at Bhimili coast in Vizag and remained on the shore without going back, and locals were catching them. This incident did not occur due to Migzam cyclone. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Andhrajyoti published in Election Special that a leaked audio of Revanth Reddy threatening contractors on the phone saying he is the future CM and if they don't send money in two days, he will file cases, is going viral on social media.
fact: Andhrajyoti did not publish the article in the viral post. ABN Andhrajyoti clarified through social media that this article is fake. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: This is a video of police officers dancing with joy as Congress party came to power in Telangana.
fact: This video has been circulating on social media since August 2023, i.e., before the Telangana elections. In the viral video, the Punjabi song heard in the original video has been edited with a Telugu song and shared. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Neil Armstrong converted to Islam after hearing the 'Azan' sound on the moon.
fact: While it is true that the person in astronaut clothes in the viral post is Neil Armstrong, the person in Islamic clothes is not him. His name is Pierre Vogel, he is an Islamic preacher, former boxer. According to a Washington Post article and Neil Armstrong's biography, Neil Armstrong never converted to Islam. He also sent letters to embassies of various countries rejecting these rumors. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Congress won in 24 seats due to postal votes cast by employees in unity in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections.
fact: According to the 2023 Assembly election data held in Telangana, only in Chevella constituency, the majority (268) obtained by Kalle Yadayya, who won on behalf of Bharat Rashtra Samithi party, is less than the postal votes (969) he received. In no constituency won by Congress did postal votes exceed the majority or have an impact. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photos of BRS party MLAs Padi Kaushik Reddy and Tellam Venkatrao meeting Revanth Reddy to join Congress party.
fact: These two photos going viral are old. The photo of Kaushik Reddy with Revanth Reddy is from June 2021 when they met. Tellam Venkatrao said that old photos from when he was in Congress party are now being made viral. As of December 4, 2023, it was not reported anywhere that Padi Kaushik Reddy and Tellam Venkatrao left BRS party and joined Congress party. Both of them also denied these reports. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Kishan Reddy's comments that BJP is thinking of declaring Lord Rama as the national god, and 'Way2News' news article reporting it.
fact: This photo has been edited. This photo was created by morphing a news article published by 'Way2News' in August 2023 stating that Kishan Reddy clarified in Lok Sabha that there is no plan to declare cow as the national animal. Kishan Reddy never commented that BJP is thinking of declaring Lord Rama as the national god. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Revanth Reddy admitting before media that Congress will lose in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections.
fact: This video shows scenes of Revanth Reddy speaking to media after losing from Kodangal constituency in the 2018 Telangana Assembly elections. The video shared in the post is old and not related to the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Disha newspaper published that KCR is vacating Pragati Bhavan as reports are coming that BRS has no chance of winning more than 18 seats.
fact: When searched based on the link at the bottom of the viral news article, it led to a different article. Moreover, we noticed that Disha News management informed through their website and X post that the viral post is fake. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Disha newspaper article being shared stating that Congress promised to build pakka houses for Rohingya Muslims living in Hyderabad.
fact: 'Disha' newspaper did not recently publish any article stating that Congress promised to build pakka houses for Rohingya Muslims. This photo was created by editing an article published on page 6 of the November 27, 2023 edition of 'Disha Hyderabad Tabloid' newspaper. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: This photo is of Arunachala temple grandly decorated with Karthika Pournami deepam.
fact: This is a photo created through Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools, not a photo of Arunachala temple. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: There are 20 universities in India to teach Quran but not even one to teach Bhagavad Gita and Ramayana.
fact: Although it is true that many universities in the country offer courses related to Quran, many universities also offer courses on Bhagavad Gita. For example, educational institutions like Kurukshetra University, Indira Gandhi National Open University, Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts offer courses on Bhagavad Gita. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Uttar Pradesh government issued a gazette notification changing the name of Lucknow city to its original name Laxmanapuri.
fact: Uttar Pradesh government has not issued any gazette notification or announcement changing the name of Lucknow to Laxmanapuri. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Videos posted by actor Arjun Kapoor and cricketer Kuldeep Yadav wishing for the victory of Patancheru BRS candidate Gudem Mahipal Reddy.
fact: These posts shared personalized videos published by FNP and 'auromaxdigital' YouTube channels. Arjun Kapoor or cricketer Kuldeep Yadav did not post any videos wishing for Mahipal Reddy's victory. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: National Samajwadi Party will contest in the upcoming Assembly elections. This party and TDP have the bicycle symbol. Since Samajwadi Party is a national party, the Election Commission will give another symbol to TDP which is a regional party.
fact: Samajwadi Party is a regional (state) party, not a national party. This party has not announced anywhere that it will contest in Andhra Pradesh elections. If Samajwadi Party wants to contest as a regional party in Andhra Pradesh elections, it must follow special rules according to Election Symbols (Reservation and Allotment) Order, 1968 Para 10. This order does not mention rules if a national party with a regional party having the same symbol wants to contest. Regarding party symbols, according to Para 9 (b), even if any new party meets the conditions for state party recognition mentioned in Para 6A, a symbol allotted to a state party cannot be given to another party in a different state. However, if before the 1997 amendment a political party has reserved its symbol, and the same symbol is also reserved for state parties in other states, the rule mentioned in clause (b) does not apply to that party. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Revanth Reddy in India Today Round Table program said he has nothing to do with the six guarantees promised by Congress party.
fact: This is a fake news clip. It has been digitally morphed. Way2News organization also clarified that this is fake news. Moreover, the comments attributed to Revanth Reddy in the viral clip were not made by Revanth Reddy in the India Today Round Table program. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: If you give Lambadas a thousand rupees and pour alcohol, they will vote - Telangana PCC President Revanth Reddy.
fact: Revanth Reddy did not make these comments addressing Lambadas. Earlier, KCR while speaking attributed these comments to Revanth Reddy. However, while explaining these allegations made by KCR in the road show held in Parigil, he reiterated the same comments. However, in this explanation, Revanth Reddy's speech was inappropriately edited (cut before/after), only the clip where Revanth Reddy reiterated these comments was cut, and made to appear as if Revanth Reddy really commented this way. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Scenes of Revanth Reddy asking people for votes while promoting Aleru Congress candidate Beerla Ailayya's land grabbing.
fact: This video has been edited. In the original video, Revanth Reddy, alleging that Aleru BRS candidate Sunita committed land irregularities in Yadagirigutta, requested people to make Beerla Ailayya win with a majority of 30 thousand. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Recent scenes of BRS party workers attacking BJP workers.
fact: The incident in the video took place in Janagam district in February 2022. BRS workers took up this protest program in Janagam protesting the comments made by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in Parliament regarding the formation of Telangana state. As part of the protest, while setting fire to the effigy of Narendra Modi, BRS workers beat BJP workers who obstructed like this. The video shared in the post is old and not related to the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The Supreme Court said in a 1976 judgment related to a litigation that Ramayana is a fictional text.
fact: On September 16, 1976, the Supreme Court issued a judgment lifting the ban imposed by the Uttar Pradesh government on the controversial book 'Sacchi Ramayana', a translation of the book written by Periyar. However, the Supreme Court did not mention anywhere in this judgment that Ramayana is a fictional text. The Supreme Court issued a judgment agreeing with the Allahabad High Court decision only after examining the legal aspect of whether the Uttar Pradesh government imposed a ban on this book under the law. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Video of Revanth Reddy saying they will distribute ₹10,000 along with liquor per vote to win in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections.
fact: This video has been edited. In the full video, Revanth Reddy said that KCR is thinking of distributing ₹10,000 along with liquor per vote. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of a person describing an incident in Abdul Kalam's life stating that Abdul Kalam considered idol worship as foolishness.
fact: Photos and videos of Abdul Kalam performing worship to idols when he visited the Swami Narayan temple in Toronto, Canada, Bangalore ISKCON temple, and other temples are available on the internet. There is no official evidence stating that Abdul Kalam considered idol worship as foolishness. Abdul Kalam did not mention anywhere in his autobiography book 'Wings of Fire' about the incident described in the video. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: 'Disha' news article stating that KTR commented that 33 Congress candidates are regularly in touch with them.
fact: 'Disha' news organization did not publish the article in the photo shared in the post. 'Disha' news organization also clarified through Facebook post that this news article going viral on social media in their name is fake. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Muslims attacking Hindus doing bhajan in front of a temple on the occasion of Karthika month in Karnataka.
fact: The incident in this video took place in Ahmednagar, Maharashtra, not in Karnataka. On the occasion of Somavati Amavasya in the Kanif Nath Mandir premises in Guha village in Rahuri taluka, one group performed bhajan using loudspeakers. However, when other groups objected to the loudspeakers, a quarrel broke out between the two groups. Based on complaints from both groups, Ahmednagar police filed cases against about 124 people in two separate FIRs. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Teenmar Mallanna resigned from Congress party and joined BRS party.
fact: This photo is related to the day when Telangana Congress leader Jitta Balakrishna Reddy and former TNGO association president Mamilla Rajender joined Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) in the presence of BRS working president KTR. In the original photo, Teenmar Mallanna's face was placed in place of Mamilla Rajender's face and edited and shared. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Video of a woman there stopping Jubilee Hills MLA Maganti Gopinath who went for 2023 election campaign.
fact: This incident took place during the 2018 elections. News articles at that time reported that a woman questioned MLA Maganti Gopinath why he came for election campaign without solving problems in the colony. Currently, this video has nothing to do with the elections happening in 2023. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Screenshot of news article published by 'Disha' news organization about the midnight meeting of Chandrababu and Revanth Reddy.
fact: 'Disha' newspaper did not publish the article shared in the post. 'Disha' news organization clarified that they did not publish this article going viral on social media, and that some political forces are sharing this fake news clipping morphed with the intention of confusing people using their newspaper's name. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of KCR bowing at Sonia Gandhi's feet.
fact: The photo shared in the post is morphed. Two separate photos of Sonia Gandhi and KCR were edited to create this photo. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: 273 votes were needed to pass the Telangana Bill in Parliament, and it passed with Congress-113, TRS-2, BJP-185 votes.
fact: The Andhra Pradesh Reorganization Bill, 2014 related to the formation of Telangana was passed by voice vote in Parliament. No separate voting took place on this bill. However, BJP supported this bill. In the 2009 general elections, the UPA alliance won 262 seats while the BJP-led NDA alliance won 159 seats. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Self-driving taxi service seen in this video launched for the first time in Chennai
fact: This video was shot in Tempe city in Arizona, USA, not in Chennai. Waymo self-driving car service doesn't exist in our country. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video taken while transporting Kia cars by train in Andhra Pradesh
fact: This incident occurred in Cambodia in 2022. The train visible in the video is a Royal Railway train of Cambodia, transporting Ford Everest and Ford pickup trucks from Poi Pet to Phnom Penh. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Photo of Tamil Nadu's current Public Works Department Minister E.V. Velu previously riding Karunanidhi's rickshaw.
fact: The person riding DMK former leader Karunanidhi's rickshaw in this photo is not E.V. Velu. This photo was taken during a campaign event organized by Karunanidhi in Chennai during the 1991 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections. E.V. Velu, who started his career as a bus conductor, first contested and won in the 1984 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections on behalf of AIADMK party. No news organization reported E.V. Velu campaigning for DMK party during the 1991 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections. E.V. Velu joined the DMK party in 2000. Some Tamil Nadu journalists also clarified that it is not E.V. Velu riding Karunanidhi's rickshaw in this photo. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Under Telangana Congress Party's Minority Declaration, newly married Christians and Muslims ₹1,60,000, Imam and Pastor salaries ₹12,000, 10th pass ₹10,000, Inter pass ₹15,000, Degree pass ₹25,000, PG ₹1,00,000, M.Phil completion ₹5,00,000 announced. No such announcement made for Hindus.
fact: As announced in the Telangana Pradesh Congress Committee (TPCC) Minority Declaration, schemes were also announced for other communities through the manifesto on November 17, 2023. Under the Vidya Jyothi scheme, financial assistance is proposed for SC, ST students to complete higher education. Under Women and Child Welfare, under the Kalyanamastu scheme, financial assistance of Rs. 1,00,000 along with 10 grams of gold is proposed for every poor girl's marriage. Additionally, Rs. 12,000 salary is proposed for Hindu temple and tribal priests. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: False propaganda that Australian cricketer Mitchell Marsh's photo of legs on a stool was edited to show legs on the World Cup trophy.
fact: After Australia's team won the World Cup, team captain Pat Cummins uploaded a photo of teammate Mitchell Marsh with his legs on the World Cup trophy on his Instagram story. There was also online discussion about how appropriate it was for Marsh to put his legs on the trophy. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Rahul Gandhi, speaking in a meeting about Bharat Mata, said 'BJP people say Bharat Mata Ki Jai, but I don't know who she is or where she is'
fact: This meeting took place in Bundi district, Rajasthan. Questioning people, Rahul Gandhi asked 'Everyone says Bharat Mata Ki Jai, but who is Bharat Mata, what does it mean?' and continuing his speech, Rahul Gandhi said 'Bharat Mata means the people of the country, all of you, your brothers, sisters, parents, poor people of the country. If we don't know how many Dalits, backward classes, tribals are in the country, what is the meaning of 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan, I raised this issue in Parliament too. A revolutionary work should happen in the country - a 'caste census' should be conducted.' He described the people of the country as Bharat Mata. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of Revanth Reddy publicly threatening people about power cuts if Congress wins.
fact: The video shared in the post is edited. This video was created by joining different video clips from Revanth Reddy's speech at the Congress Wardhannapet meeting. In the original video, Revanth Reddy commented that if Congress comes to power, he would cut the power of KCR, KTR, Harish Rao and some other heavyweight leaders. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Narendra Modi ignored Australian captain Pat Cummins and walked away during the World Cup trophy presentation ceremony.
fact: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the World Cup winning Australian team and their captain Pat Cummins with a handshake. The video shared in the post was created by clipping only the visuals of Narendra Modi handing over the trophy to Pat Cummins and going down the stage. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Revanth Reddy abused people who chanted KCR slogans at a Congress meeting.
fact: This video clip is from the meeting held in 2021 when Revanth Reddy assumed charge as TPCC president. While Revanth Reddy was speaking, people in the meeting chanted 'CM' slogans, not KCR slogans. Against this, Revanth Reddy expressed anger saying, 'From today, anyone who makes any personal slogans other than Jai Soniamma, Jai Congress will be expelled from the party. I appeal that even those who admire me should not give such personal slogans.' This full video of the meeting is being trimmed at various timestamps and shared. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Photo of V.S. Achuthanandan, who previously lived life as a communist leader, now visiting temples with a tilak on his forehead.
fact: This photo is morphed. In the original photo, V.S. Achuthanandan does not have a tilak on his forehead. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Letter written by Chandrababu Naidu requesting the Kamma community in Telangana to support the Congress party in the elections.
fact: Telugu Desam Party clarified that the letter going viral in Chandrababu's name asking to support the Congress party in Telangana elections is fake. TDP leaders also filed a complaint with Hyderabad Cyber Crime Cyber Police in this regard. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Israeli army sending a woman living in Israel back to Gaza on Israeli government orders for posting in support of Hamas on social media.
fact: Israeli security officials arrested the woman in the video on charges of putting status on WhatsApp in favor of organizations that Israel considers terrorist. Israeli officials in the video stated they are arresting this Palestinian woman with Israeli citizenship for questioning on suspicion of ties to terrorist organizations. Israeli officials nowhere in this video said she should go back to Gaza. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Some people chanted Congress slogans while KTR was speaking at a public meeting in Kodangal.
fact: This is an edited video. Actually, when KTR was giving a speech at a meeting in Kodangal on November 9, 2023, no one chanted slogans in support of Congress party as shown in the viral video. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A jawan working at the border protecting our country is giving a message about the right to vote near Karimnagar bus stand.
fact: The person in this photo is Kota Shyam Kumar from Karimnagar district. He told the media that many people are careless about exercising their right to vote, and he is doing this to create awareness about voting among such people. Shyam has contested as an independent candidate in elections held in various areas of the state since 2018. Looking at his affidavit details and Facebook profile, it was found that he is self-employed. Also, he never mentioned anywhere that he worked in the Indian Army. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: In textbooks revised during Congress rule, only Mughal history was glorified and Hindu kings' history was completely ignored.
fact: In social science textbooks that came after NCERT was established in 1961 during Congress government rule, the history of Mauryas, Cholas, Gupta, Pallava, Satavahana and other empires was told in detail. Even in the textbooks currently in use in Congress-ruled states, there are chapters about Hindu kings' history. Therefore, the claim shared in the post is false.

claim: T-PCC President Revanth Reddy said that if necessary, temple lands will be auctioned to raise funds for implementing Muslim Declaration and the money raised will be used to support Muslims.
fact: Way2News clarified this through an X post saying this is a fake post created using their logo. Subsequently, it was found that NTV did not publish any such headlines. Moreover, there is no information anywhere that Revanth Reddy made these comments. Therefore, the claim made in these posts is false.

claim: Congress government in Karnataka cut student scholarships; previously Rs. 60,000 & Rs. 35,000 MBBS and PG student scholarships reduced to Rs. 11,000 & Rs. 10,000.
fact: What the Congress government in Karnataka reduced is only the scholarships provided to children of construction workers related to the Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board of that state's Labor Ministry. Scholarships provided to other students through other departments continue as usual. For example, there is no change in scholarships being provided to BCs, minorities, etc. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: On August 5, 2020, Rahul Gandhi and other Congress MPs protested by wearing black clothes against the foundation laying of Ramjanmabhoomi temple.
fact: This photo was taken when Rahul Gandhi and other Congress MPs protested in August 2022 by wearing black clothes against price rise, unemployment, and GST increase on essential items. This incident did not happen in 2020 as mentioned in the claim, but on August 5, 2022. This photo has nothing to do with Ram Janmabhoomi temple. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of hundreds of people arriving at the railway station to attend Madiga Vishwaroopa Maha Sabha.
fact: This video shows hundreds of passengers waiting for trains at Kalyani Sub-Urban Railway Station in Kolkata city, West Bengal state during Durga Puja and Dussehra festival. This video has been shared on social media since October 25, 2023. This video has nothing to do with Madiga Vishwaroopa Maha Sabha. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Supreme Court questioned how Jagan Mohan Reddy is running a political party with all these cases.
fact: This is a screenshot of an article published on the Live Law website on February 12, 2018. In a PIL seeking to ban convicted persons from leading political parties, the Supreme Court expressed its opinion that a person who is a criminal, corrupt, or convicted should not lead a political party. However, the court asked the central government to take a final stance on this issue. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: TV9 news report video about India Today survey that recently predicted TRS (BRS) victory in 2023 Telangana Assembly elections.
fact: Actually, this video clip is from a TV9 news report about a survey conducted by India Today during the 2018 Telangana Assembly elections. This five-year-old India Today survey news report is being circulated on social media saying it's predicting upcoming elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of BRS Working President KTR asking to vote for Congress.
fact: Recently, as part of election campaign, KTR made these comments addressing Y.S. Sharmila at a lawyers' meeting held in Jalvihar. KTR commented that Sharmila said 'Defeating KCR is my life goal, so I am withdrawing, vote for Congress'. However, in these comments, Sharmila's mention was removed and only the comments 'vote for Congress' are being attributed to KTR and shared. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Kaladan Project was designed by Modi government. It is a mega highway built across the Bay of Bengal connecting northeastern states.
fact: The Kaladan Multi-Modal Transit Transport Project was started in 2008 during the Congress-led UPA government rule. This project provides both land and sea routes along with inland waterways. This project is part of India's efforts to enhance connectivity with neighboring countries and strengthen economic relations. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of BRS workers cheering for Revanth Reddy at KCR's Kamareddy meeting.
fact: The video shared in the post is edited. This video was created by joining different video clips from the full video showing KCR's speech at Kamareddy meeting. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Congress leader Supriya Shrinate questioned why GST is not being levied on Hindu puja items.
fact: In this video, Supriya Shrinate shows a letter from the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, in which 10 puja-related items like rudraksha mala, yajnopavitam, vibhuti, roli and sandalwood were exempted from GST tax, but alleged that Gangajal was not included by the BJP government as an item exempted from GST. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Recently, Israel questioned Arab countries at the United Nations about the Jewish population in their countries.
fact: This video is not current. The viral clip is part of a speech made by UN Watch's Executive Director Hillel Neuer during a UN Human Rights Council discussion in March 2017. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: According to New Education Policy 2020, there will be no public exams for 10th class.
fact: There is no proposal in the National New Education Policy to cancel board exams for 10th class. According to this new policy, board exams will continue in 10th and 12th classes. Moreover, the new education policy proposed to conduct board exams twice in one academic year to reduce pressure on students. One is the main exam and the other is the improvement exam. Students can take the improvement exam to improve their marks. However, Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan recently clarified that it will come into effect from the coming academic year (2024-25). Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of Maharashtra/UP police arresting a girl for wearing short clothes.
fact: What is shared in the post is a fake arrest video featuring fashion influencer Urfi Javed. Those appearing in this video are not real police officers. Mumbai police took legal action against Urfi Javed and other co-actors for filming fake arrest videos while wearing police uniforms. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Grains were transported to Telangana because minimum support price was not available in Karnataka.
fact: This photo is from May 2022 showing visuals of trucks stopped by police at Narayanpet district when they attempted to transport grains to Telangana as farmers did not receive support price from the government in Karnataka. This is not a recent incident. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Photos of Ayodhya railway station in Uttar Pradesh state.
fact: These are photos created by Artificial Intelligence, not real photos of Ayodhya railway station. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: This is a video of an Israeli woman released from Hamas captivity describing her experiences.
fact: The woman appearing in the video is Vian Dakhil. She is a Yazidi Iraqi Parliament member. This is a video from an interview she gave in 2017 describing the heinous atrocities committed by Islamic State (ISIS) terrorists. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of people chanting 'Jai KCR' slogans at a Congress meeting in Palamuru.
fact: This video is from a recent Congress meeting in Kolhapur. KCR supportive slogans were digitally morphed and added to the viral video. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Visuals of Junior NTR meeting Chandrababu after the latter was granted interim bail in the Skill Development case.
fact: This video shows Junior NTR going to Narayana Hrudayalaya Hospital in Bangalore to visit Taraka Ratna who was undergoing treatment after suffering a heart attack in January 2023. The visuals of Chandrababu, Balakrishna and Lokesh appearing in the video were also taken when Taraka Ratna was being treated at Narayana Hrudayalaya Hospital. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Congress leader Feroz Khan said BJP will win more seats in Telangana in the 2023 elections.
fact: This is a video of Feroz Khan sharing his predictions on election results in an interview on July 12, 2022. These are not recent predictions. Therefore, this is misleading.

claim: Video showing Hamas displaying living people as dead for sympathy.
fact: This is a video from 2013 of a group of students from Al-Azhar University in Cairo, Egypt participating in an 'anti-coup' protest. This has no connection to the Israel-Palestine issue. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Visuals of Z+ convoy going to Rajahmundry for Chandrababu Naidu.
fact: This video is from November 2021 when Chandrababu Naidu toured flood-affected areas in Kadapa. This video has been available on social media since 2021. This video has been available on the internet since before bail was granted in the Skill Development scam case. Therefore, what the post says is false.

claim: Pouring water on the head first while bathing can cause sudden increase in blood circulation in the head area leading to risk of brain stroke and paralysis.
fact: Generally, high blood pressure, diabetes, obesity, high cholesterol, excessive alcohol consumption, smoking, etc. are factors that lead to brain stroke. However, there is no scientific evidence that pouring water on the head can cause risk of brain stroke/paralysis. Experts have also refuted this claim. Therefore, what the post says is false.

claim: Not even one student who studied in government schools and colleges is getting selected for prestigious educational institutions like IIT.
fact: There are many examples across the country of students studying in government schools and colleges securing seats in exams like IIT, JEE, NEET, etc. In Telugu states too, there are examples of students studying in government educational institutions securing seats in competitive exams like IIT, JEE, NEET. Therefore, what the post says is misleading.

claim: Video of D.K. Shivakumar coming fully drunk for Karnataka election campaign.
fact: This video is from 2022 related to the padayatra organized by D.K. Shivakumar demanding quick construction of the Mekedatu project on the Kaveri river. This video has nothing to do with the current Karnataka Assembly election campaign. Therefore, what the post says is misleading.

claim: BRS leader Koushik Reddy commented that BJP will score a century in the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections, BRS party will be ducked out, and Congress will be run out.
fact: The video shared in the post is edited. Koushik Reddy said in a press meet held on October 20, 2023, that BRS party will score a century in the upcoming 2023 Telangana Assembly elections, BJP will be ducked out, and Congress will be run out. The audio in the original video was edited to create this video. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of some Muslim women in Kerala arguing with a Hindu woman saying they won't allow her into the bus without a burqa.
fact: There is no religious angle to this incident. This incident occurred on October 20, 2023, near Kansa Women's College in Kasargod area of Kerala. When some students came in front of the bus and protested because buses were not stopping in front of their college, at the same time the students had an argument with a woman named Asha who was on the bus for stopping the bus. Asha, the college principal, local police, and bus conductor clarified that there is no religious angle to this. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The tree that bleeds blood when cut with a knife exists only in Yemen.
fact: Although these Dragon Blood trees originated in the Socotra islands of Yemen, this species of trees and some other subspecies grow in many places around the world. What comes out when this tree bark is cut is not blood, it is tree sap. It is used in the manufacture of many medicines and dyes. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: What appears in this video is a robot named Nami created by A.I.
fact: What is in this video is not a robot, but a digital video creator on Instagram with the name qian_princess. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Muslims displayed the Italy flag instead of the Palestine flag in a recent rally held in Kerala in support of Palestine.
fact: This photo shows an image from a rally organized by the Welfare Party of India in Kozhikode city, Kerala state, in support of Palestine. What the protesters are holding in this photo is the flag of the Welfare Party of India, not the Italy flag. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Recent visuals of a Palestine militant dying when a mortar accidentally exploded while launching bombs at the Israeli army.
fact: This video shared in the post has been shared on the internet since at least 2007. Several news agencies shared this video in 2007 saying it shows visuals of an Iraqi rebel accidentally killed when a mortar exploded while launching mortar shells. The video shared in the post is old and not related to the current Israel-Palestine war. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: According to Waqf Act Section 101, Board members are considered Public Servants. They get protection under IPC Section 27. No temple board members have such authority.
fact: Not only Waqf Board members, but temple Endowment (Devasthanam) Board members are also considered as Government Servants (Public Servants). IPC Section 27 does not discuss Public Servants. Therefore, the claim in this post is misleading.

claim: Video of BRS Minister Malla Reddy criticizing his own party.
fact: This is an edited video. Parts of Minister Malla Reddy's speech at a BRS meeting in Medchal on October 18, 2023, were edited to create this video making it seem like he criticized BRS. In reality, Malla Reddy praised BRS party and CM KCR in his speech. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Hitler making Jews strip and putting them in containers and brutally killing them with tear gas.
fact: Although the visuals shown at the end of this video are of Hitler's concentration camps, the scene at the beginning of the video showing people being sent into containers without clothes is from a Swedish short film called Härlig er jorden directed by Roy Andersson in 1991. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Israeli terrorists are filming a fake video as if Hamas attacked.
fact: This video is a clip from the making video of a short film called 'Empty Place' directed by Palestinian filmmaker Avani Eshtaive dated April 19, 2022. Therefore, the claim in this post is misleading.

claim: Amritpal recruited through Agniveer died in Poonch, Jammu and Kashmir. His body was brought in a private vehicle, the Army unit did not attend the cremation, and he was not provided Army Guard of Honor.
fact: The Army investigation confirmed that Agniveer Amritpal Singh committed suicide, which is why he was not provided any posthumous honor or military funeral, the Indian Army clarified through 'X'. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Police caught Rs. 750 crores cash near Gadwal being transported in a truck from Kerala to Telangana in the context of Telangana elections.
fact: Election officials confirmed that this Rs. 750 crores cash caught by police at Pulluru checkpost in Jogulamba Gadwal district belongs to Union Bank of India. It was found that police seized this vehicle with suspicion while Union Bank of India was transporting money from Kerala to their banks in Telangana. This container caught with Rs. 750 crores is not related to any political party. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of Congress party leaders clashing as soon as Congress party released the first list for 2023 Assembly elections in Madhya Pradesh.
fact: The incident appearing in the video occurred at a BJP meeting in Uttar Pradesh state in 2019. This video shows BJP MP Sharad Tripathi arguing and fighting with his party MLA Rakesh Singh. It was found that they clashed over putting their names on the foundation stone of a project being constructed in Uttar Pradesh state. This video is not related to Congress party. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of dargah pandal lighting arranged by Congress government in Karnataka at the historic Mysuru Dussehra festival instead of Durga.
fact: This lighting has been arranged on Sayyaji Road in Mysuru city as part of Dussehra festival for several years. During Dussehra festival during the previous BJP government, this pandal was decorated with green lights in the same way. This pandal was not introduced by the current Congress government. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Both DMK government in Tamil Nadu and Congress government in Karnataka issued G.Os prohibiting the use of flowers, kumkum, turmeric and other items necessary for puja in Ayudha Puja in government offices.
fact: The management of Tiruppur College in Tamil Nadu clarified that the notice in circulation on social media is fake and they did not issue it. The notice issued by Karnataka government only states that puja materials made with chemical substances should not be used in historic buildings like Vidhana Soudha, Vikasa Soudha. Moreover, the previous BJP government also issued a notice with the same rules. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Saudi Arabia's King Mohammed bin Salman announced that from now on Ramayana and Mahabharata will be taught in schools there.
fact: These claims are mainly based on a tweet by Saudi resident Nauf Almarway. The curriculum used by International Indian School in Saudi Arabia is different from the curriculum in private or public schools there. In public schools there, all subjects are taught in Arabic language only. Since the questions shared on Twitter are in English, it can be said it is an international school. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Video of Muslims beating an old man for chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans.
fact: The incident in this video occurred in Bilwara district of Rajasthan state in October 2019. This video shows visuals of some people beating a person named Hotchand Sindhi for abusing others over a money dispute. The old man was not beaten for chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogans. Also, there is no religious angle to this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Saudi Prince Mohammed bin Salman made US Secretary of State Antony Blinken wait for two days and finally sent him back without meeting.
fact: Several news agencies reported that Saudi Prince Mohammed bin Salman made US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, who went to Saudi Arabia on October 14, 2023 to discuss the Israel-Palestine issue, wait for hours and finally met the next day. Details of the meeting between Antony Blinken and Saudi Prince Mohammed bin Salman on October 15, 2023 were officially published on their websites by the US government and Saudi Foreign Ministry. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: People in Israel are conducting massive protests against Prime Minister Netanyahu.
fact: This is a photo from early 2023 of a protest by people opposing judicial reforms proposed by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government. This is not a protest in the context of ongoing Israel-Palestine clashes. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: These videos show visuals of Egyptian citizens carrying food for Palestinians.
fact: Both these videos have been on the internet since before October 7, 2023 when Hamas attacked Israel. These have no connection to the current Israel-Palestine war. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: This is a video of an incident in Andhra Pradesh where a traffic police officer stopped and pushed aside a man riding a bicycle.
fact: This incident occurred in Uttar Pradesh, not Andhra Pradesh.
