When Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya's convoy was going on the road during campaigning for Ghosi Assembly by-elections, a man on a bicycle came in the way, Sub-Inspector Kedarnath Bharti stopped the man and asked him to move aside, but when the man did not listen, Kedarnath Bharti grabbed him and pushed him aside. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Pakistan national flag was displayed at Lulu Mall in Kochi.
fact: Lulu Mall Kochi said in a press release that on the occasion of the start of the 2023 Men's World Cup, they displayed flags of ten countries participating in the World Cup competition at Lulu Mall Kochi. Photos with all the flags also appeared in news articles. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Recent photos of Israeli women fighting Palestine with weapons.
fact: The first photo shows a promotional picture taken as part of the 'Defend Children' campaign organized by an organization called 'Silver Roses' in 2019. Another post shared an old photo of Orin Julie, who once worked as a reservist in the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) and is currently a podcast host and doing modeling. All the photos shared in these posts are old and not related to the current Israel-Palestine war. Therefore, the claim shared in the post is false.

claim: This is a scene of a teacher beating a student in an RSS school.
fact: This incident occurred at a private school called Kishori Balika Vidyalaya in Sidhauli, Uttar Pradesh state. This is not an RSS school. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: A video is heavily circulating on social media claiming to show visuals of Hamas terrorists parachuting down in Israel.
fact: First, when we did a reverse image search of this video, we found that the same video was uploaded on YouTube on September 29, 2023. However, this video was mentioned as being taken near the Heliopolis area near Cairo city in Egypt. Also, we noticed that 'EL NASR SC' is written on the T-shirts of the people in the video. Based on this, when we searched, it became clear that this video was taken at El-Nasr Sporting Club near Cairo city.

claim: Visuals of police detaining a girl addicted to drugs in Koramangala, Bangalore. Her parents handed this girl over to police.
fact: This incident occurred in Mangaluru, not Bangalore. In September 2023, when a girl was behaving aggressively near Ganesha Medicals in Mangaluru city, Excise Department officials tried to detain her with suspicion that she had taken drugs, and she argued with them. Mangaluru City Police gave an explanation on this matter, saying that when she was tested at the hospital, the test revealed that she had not taken any drugs. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blessed his son who is going into the war happening in 2023.
fact: This is a photo from nine years ago in 2014 of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife Sarah bidding farewell to their younger son Avner. This photo is not from now. Therefore, the claim in this post is misleading.

claim: Seven lakh people in America left Christianity and converted to Hinduism, creating a world record.
fact: According to a study by Pew Research Center, there was a decline in Christian population and an increase in Hindu population in America between 2007-14. However, the study did not mention that Christians are leaving their religion and converting to Hinduism. The majority of Hindus in America are immigrants. It stated that one reason for the decline in Christian population is the increase in the number of people with no religious affiliation. However, there is no evidence or reports anywhere that seven lakh people in America left Christianity and converted to Hinduism. Therefore, what the post says is misleading.

claim: Pakistani Islamic preacher Khalid Mehmood Abbasi made threatening comments to India saying that Pakistan will do to Hindus in India just as Hamas did to Israel.
fact: It was not reported anywhere that Khalid Mehmood Abbasi made these comments. He also posted on X that he did not make such statements. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Coconut oil prevents dengue. Keeping raw cardamom seeds on both sides of the mouth increases blood cells. The homeopathy medicine 'Eupatorium Perfoliatum 200 CH' cures dengue in two days.
fact: Coconut oil does not prevent dengue. Cardamom seeds do not increase blood cells. 'Eupatorium Perfoliatum 200 CH' may be indicated for dengue fever, but there is no information to prove that it can cure dengue in just two days. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of a leopard roaming near Minister Jagadish Reddy's guest house in Suryapet.
fact: The first video clip in the video shows visuals from 2022 of a leopard attacking police and forest department officials in Panipat district of Haryana state. The second video clip shows visuals from December 2022 of a leopard appearing to walk on a wall near Manesar Valley in Gurugram city. Both video clips shared in the post are old and not related to Suryapet district in Telangana state. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: In this video, a TDP councillor is beating a Janasena party councillor.
fact: First, this incident occurred in Tenali in 2016. This is a video of an incident during Tenali Municipal Council meeting where two TDP party councillors named Gummadi Ramesh and Pasupuleti Trimurthulu attacked each other. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: India surpassed Nigeria in poverty.
fact: Although Nigeria has fewer people in poverty than India in terms of population, in terms of percentage, Nigeria has a higher poverty ratio. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Diabetes can be completely controlled by keeping feet on cow dung cakes for a long time.
fact: There is no scientific evidence to say that cow dung has the ability to control diabetes or that liver and heart diseases can be reduced by keeping feet on cow dung cakes. In 2007, several news agencies reported an incident where some Hyderabad city residents walked on cow dung arranged in a cowshed believing that walking on cow dung reduces diabetes. However, doctors responded to this incident at that time saying there is no scientific evidence for the medicinal properties of cow dung and all this seems like comedy to them. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Paytm announced an offer to get full refund on train ticket cancellation by paying just Rs.15 premium regardless of travel distance.
fact: It is true that Paytm recently announced a facility to get full refund on train ticket cancellation by paying a premium. However, the premium to be paid for this free cancellation facility starts from Rs. 15 and increases based on travel distance, class, etc. Moreover, Paytm clearly stated that this offer is applicable only to some selected trains available for booking on the Paytm app. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of a man who died immediately after drinking water while talking on a plugged-in phone.
fact: This video is actually scripted. This video was posted on Indian badminton player Gutta Jwala's Facebook page on February 2, 2020. It is mentioned in the video description that this is a scripted video and this video was made for entertainment. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Supreme Court dismissed all petitions filed against Stalin's Sanatana Dharma comments.
fact: The Supreme Court has not yet given any verdict on this petition, it kept the verdict pending by tagging an already pending matter. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: Even if you pay premium and renew the policy after the grace period for LIC policy, accident coverage will not apply for that year.
fact: According to policy rules, there is an opportunity to revive a lapsed policy within five consecutive years from the date of first non-payment of premium. First, after reviving the lapsed policy, accident coverage should also be revived. However, according to LIC rules, LIC has the discretion to accept/reject policy revival/accept with changes in previous policy rules. However, there is no provision anywhere that accident coverage will not apply for that year even if the policy is renewed. Therefore, what the post says is misleading.

claim: The Ashok Gehlot government in Rajasthan responds to matters of compensation for Muslims, but does not respond quickly in matters concerning Hindus.
fact: There are examples where the Rajasthan government has provided compensation beyond caste and religion in many instances. For example, last year, the government provided Rs 50 lakh compensation to the family of Kanhaiya Lal, a tailor who was killed by two Muslim men, and provided government jobs to his two sons. Additionally, the government also provided jobs to two Hindu individuals who helped in catching the two accused who were fleeing after this murder. The government made amendments to existing rules and provided jobs to them. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: A procession with Pakistani flags took place on Tank Bund.
fact: This rally took place on Tank Bund on the occasion of Milad-un-Nabi. However, what the youth were holding were not Pakistani flags, but religious flags. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of Congress leaders discussing with KTR about which constituency and candidate should get tickets in the upcoming Telangana Assembly elections.
fact: This video shows the visuals of KTR discussing with Congress leaders Uttam Kumar Reddy and Bhatti Vikramarka in 2019 to cooperate for the unanimous election of the Telangana Assembly Deputy Speaker. The video shared in the post is old and is not related to the upcoming Telangana Assembly elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: When a Shivalinga is anointed with milk during Rahu Kalam in a village called Nagakudi near Tiruvarur, Tamil Nadu, the milk turns blue.
fact: When light falls on water mixed with a certain amount of milk, it simply appears blue. This is called the Tyndall effect. There is no scientific basis for the claim that milk turns blue during Rahu Kalam. Therefore, this post is misleading.

claim: Kangana Ranaut's comments in response to Shabana Azmi's tweet about Durga Ashtami festival.
fact: As mentioned in the post, Shabana Azmi tweeted about Hindu deities on the occasion of Durga Ashtami festival in 2017. However, Kangana Ranaut never responded to these comments made by Shabana Azmi about the Durga Ashtami festival. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A photo of Prime Minister Modi and AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi discussing together.
fact: This photo of Prime Minister Modi and AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi discussing together is not real. It is a morphed photo created by cropping two different photos. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of the Yogi government taking action against the people responsible for the death of a girl traveling on a bicycle in Uttar Pradesh.
fact: Although the incident where police opened fire on three Muslim youth who were fleeing after causing the death of a girl traveling on a bicycle in Uttar Pradesh is true, the video currently going viral is not related to this incident. This video is related to a murder case that occurred in Rajasthan. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of a Muslim person snatching a Hindu religious flag from a Hindu youth during a procession in a village in Karnataka.
fact: This incident occurred in September 2023 during a Janmashtami procession in the village of Sanoli Khurd in Haryana. Some members of Bajrang Dal entered the Muslim area of the village holding religious flags and chanting slogans. Village Sarpanch Sanjay Tyagi and village temple committee members intervened to prevent communal tensions in the village. They removed the flags and requested the group not to chant religious slogans. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Six people belonging to PFI attacked an army jawan in Kerala and wrote PFI on his back.
fact: An army jawan in Kerala filed a false complaint that a gang of six belonging to 'PFI' attacked him. Police arrested him and his friend regarding this. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: This contestant made the judges cry by singing a song about Baba Saheb Ambedkar on Indian Idol.
fact: This is an edited video, combining footage from the Indian Idol show with visuals of someone singing. Recently, many people on the internet have been sharing edited videos like this using Indian Idol footage. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Muslims brutally beating a Hindu priest in West Bengal for ringing a bell during puja at home.
fact: The incident in this video took place in August 2017. The victim's family members beat the priest on the road, accusing him of behaving inappropriately with a woman and harassing her during a home puja ceremony. Kolkata Police also clarified that there was no communal angle in this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Jyoti Yarraji from Andhra Pradesh won a gold medal for India in the women's 100 meters hurdles race at the 2023 Asian Games.
fact: Jyoti Yarraji's women's 100 meters hurdles race in the ongoing 2023 Asian Games has not yet begun. Her first race is scheduled for September 30, 2023. Meanwhile, the video currently going viral is from when Jyoti Yarraji won a gold medal at the Asian Athletics Championship 2023 held in July 2023. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: CJI Chandrachud made a statement encouraging people to protest against the government.
fact: The Supreme Court Public Relations Office (PRO) issued a press note clarifying that the viral post is fake. The Supreme Court informed through a press release that no such post was issued by the CJI. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of BJP workers protesting against Canada in front of Canara Bank.
fact: This image circulating on social media has been digitally altered. The original version of this photo from 2020 was taken during a protest in Ooty. It does not have a Canara Bank sign board. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: During the Congress regime, the old Parliament building was in a state where there were no toilets for women.
fact: What was mentioned in this video refers to toilets for the First Floor Gallery where journalists sit. However, there were separate toilets for women on other floors of Parliament. Moreover, even on the first floor gallery, separate toilets for women were built during the Congress regime in 2009 when Meera Kumar was the Speaker, as mentioned by another female journalist in this interview. This makes it clear that the claim that there were no separate toilets for women in the old Parliament building during the Congress regime is not correct. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: This video shows a hundi theft that occurred at the Venkateswara Swamy temple in Tirumala.
fact: Although this video shows a theft that occurred in a temple, this is not an incident that occurred at the Tirumala temple. Chief Security Officer Krishna Reddy was caught stealing from the hundi at Sri Nettikanti Anjaneya Swamy temple in Kasapuram village, Anantapur district. His theft was recorded on CCTV, and these visuals show this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of a Muslim shopkeeper giving juice he spat in to a customer.
fact: This is a prank video. When examining the full footage of this video, after the customer attacks the owner for giving juice he spat in, the owner shows the customer that this is a prank and that there are cameras inside the van. After that, they both laugh and hug each other. This makes it clear that a prank video is being falsely shared with a communal angle. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Nana Patekar's comments against the Congress Party regarding the Ayodhya Ram Mandir.
fact: Bollywood actor Nana Patekar did not make any such comments against the Congress Party regarding the Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid land dispute case. In 2018, on one occasion, Nana Patekar expressed his opinion that providing food to every poor person in the country should be given priority over the construction of Ram Mandir. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Nara Lokesh has been absconding for a week for fear of arrest.
fact: TV9 informed through Twitter that this statement has nothing to do with TV9 channel, and this is fake news being propagated by some people in the name of TV9. Therefore, the claim made in this video is false.

claim: Visuals from a protest program organized by communist students at Delhi JNU against Sanatana Dharma.
fact: This video shows visuals from the 'Kiss of Love' protest held in Kolkata, West Bengal state in 2014. Students from universities in Kolkata organized this 'Kiss of Love' protest against moral policing and gender discrimination. The video shared in the post is old and not related to Delhi JNU. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The words 'Socialist' and 'Secular' were removed from the Preamble of the Indian Constitution.
fact: In the Supreme Court's Kesavananda Bharati case, it was stated that the Preamble is part of the Constitution, that it can be amended, but that Parliament cannot amend its fundamental aspects. Moreover, to remove these words from the Preamble of the Constitution, an amendment process is required. The government has not made any announcement regarding this. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: TDP spokesperson Anusha Vundavalli was caught by police engaging in prostitution.
fact: Police stopped Anusha Vundavalli's padayatra midway and arrested her, which she undertook to condemn Chandrababu Naidu's arrest. The visuals currently going viral are from this incident. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Ramdev Baba's Patanjali obtained Halal certification to start selling beef.
fact: Patanjali Ayurved Limited obtained Halal certification to sell their Ayurvedic products abroad. This company does not sell any animal products. Halal is not limited only to the meat industry; Halal certification also applies to vegetarian products. Many countries (especially Muslim countries) have made this Halal certification mandatory for products they import. It is in this context that Patanjali also obtained this certification for the products the company exports abroad. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Periyar Ramaswamy advised men in the 'Viduthalai' magazine on May 11, 1953, to have sexual relations with their mothers and sisters in situations of desperate need for sex.
fact: 'Viduthalai' magazine clarified through an article on their website that this claim is false. There is no evidence in the May 11, 1953 'Viduthalai' magazine to support the claims made in the viral posts. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Pope sprinkled Indian soil on his head, describing it as the birthplace of the Bhagavad Gita and Kurukshetra.
fact: In 1986, as part of Pope John Paul II's visit to India, he knelt down and kissed the Indian soil immediately upon landing at Delhi airport. However, Pope John Paul II similarly kissed the soil when he visited Central America, Albania, and many other countries. The statement issued by John Paul II regarding the grand welcome he received at Delhi airport did not mention the Bhagavad Gita or the Kurukshetra war anywhere. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Former President Pratibha Patil recently praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi's governance.
fact: There are no news articles or press releases on the internet that former President Pratibha Patil made a public statement praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi's governance. This message shared in the post has been circulating on social media since at least 2018. Pratibha Patil's office told 'The Quint' news website that this message circulating on social media is fake. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy scolded a priest and dusted off the akshintas (sacred rice grains) that were placed on his head.
fact: CM Jagan recently went to Tirumala temple to receive silk garments on behalf of the government. A video taken while he was removing his turban and adjusting his hair is being shared with the false narrative that he scolded the priest and dusted off the akshintas placed on his head. Therefore, this claim is false.

claim: 'Father Anthony Fernandez' from the Catholic Zionist church in Goa converted back to his original Sanatan Dharma.
fact: This is a scene from a Polish TV series called 'Father Matthew' from the year 2000. Artur Zmijewski acted in the role of Father Matthew. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Video of Andhra Pradesh Additional Advocate General Ponnavolu Sudhakar Reddy dancing.
fact: The person in this video is Pabba Saidulu, who became famous through reels on social media. This video was recently uploaded on social media. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Visuals of Hindutva organizations beating and killing a Hindu Dalit woman for entering a Shiva temple in Maharashtra.
fact: This video shows four people brutally beating a Dalit widow woman for demanding back the Rs. 2000 she had given for cattle fodder. This incident took place on August 26, 2023 in the village of Panwan in Satara district of Maharashtra. There is no truth in the propaganda that this Dalit woman was beaten for entering the temple. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of teachers sleeping in their classrooms in Telangana government schools.
fact: These are not visuals from Telangana government schools. These photos are of teachers in Bihar state government schools. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: The Telangana government is constructing double bedroom houses entirely with funds provided by the central government.
fact: The Telangana government is constructing double bedroom houses by linking this scheme to the central government's Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. However, the state government's share of funds in the construction of these houses is higher than the share of funds provided by the center. For each double bedroom house built in urban areas of the state, the central government's share is Rs 1.5 lakhs, while the state government's share is Rs 3.8 lakhs. Similarly, for houses being built in Hyderabad city, the central government provides Rs 1.5 lakhs through PMAY, while for houses being built in rural areas, the center provides Rs 72,000 per house. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Janasena issued an official press note stating that the Janasena party will contest on the TDP symbol in the upcoming elections.
fact: No announcement/press note has been issued stating that the Janasena party will contest on the TDP symbol in the upcoming elections. What is currently being shared is digitally morphed. Although the Election Commission first cancelled Janasena's glass symbol, it later allocated the same symbol again. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Scene of a massive protest organized by IT employees in Hyderabad against Chandrababu's arrest.
fact: The photo shared in the post was published by aerial cinematographer Saikant Krishna on August 19, 2022, on World Photography Day. The photo shared in the post has nothing to do with the recent protest organized by IT employees in Hyderabad against Chandrababu's arrest. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The central government abolished the tax on apples imported from America.
fact: The full tax on apples imported from America was not abolished. The government only abolished the 20% additional tax imposed in 2019 against America's actions on the Most Favored Nation Duty that existed from the beginning. The government made this decision as part of the WTO agreements between India and America in June 2023. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Former Supreme Court Justice Katju wrote a letter to the President and Prime Minister stating that President's rule should be immediately imposed in the state as constitutional violations are taking place in Andhra Pradesh.
fact: There are no reports of former Justice Markandeya Katju making such comments in the context of the current situation in Andhra Pradesh state. However, Justice Katju wrote a letter to President Pranab Mukherjee and Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2017, opposing the arrest of two people by the Chandrababu Naidu government on charges of posting objectionable posts. He made such comments on that occasion. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Photo of a Shiva Lingam recently unearthed during excavations in Nallamalla forest.
fact: In reality, this Shiva Lingam was unearthed during excavations in June 2013 near Rachakonda Fort in the then Nalgonda (now Yadadri Bhuvanagiri) district. It is in the Rachakonda forest area. Therefore, the claim made in this post is misleading.

claim: ACB judge Himabindu Reddy is speaking on behalf of YSRCP.
fact: The woman in the video is YSRCP leader Himabindu Reddy. The name of the ACB judge who gave the remand verdict to TDP leader Chandrababu is B. Satya Venkata Himabindu. They are two different people. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: The leaders of various countries who recently came to India for the G20 summit did not visit any Islamic monuments, including the Taj Mahal.
fact: Leaders of Argentina, Turkey, France, and other countries who came to India as part of the G20 meetings visited several Islamic monuments in Delhi, including Humayun's Tomb and Qutub Minar. The son of the Indonesian president who came to India for the G20 meetings visited the Taj Mahal on September 09, 2023. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of streets filled with YouTuber Harsha Sai's fans who turned up in large numbers.
fact: In 2023, the French rugby team Stade Rochelais won the Champions Cup against the Irish team Leinster. On that occasion, this is a video of people welcoming the rugby champions in the city of 'La Rochelle' in France. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: ABN news channel video sharing that Andhrajyoti MD Radhakrishna's wife and daughter were caught in Mumbai's red light area.
fact: ABN news channel did not publish any such report regarding the family of Andhrajyoti organizations' MD Radhakrishna. Radhakrishna's wife Kanakadurga died of a heart attack in 2021. Many news agencies reported that her death was natural. There is no information anywhere that there was an argument between Radhakrishna and his son regarding Kanakadurga's death, or that a case was filed against Radhakrishna expressing doubts about her death. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Only Muslim women are benefiting from the Gruha Lakshmi scheme being implemented by the Congress government in Karnataka.
fact: The Karnataka government clearly stated that all women named as heads of families in Antyodaya, BPL, and APL ration cards issued by the Food and Civil Supplies Department are eligible for the 'Gruha Lakshmi' scheme. Women of all religions, including Muslims, have applied for this scheme to benefit from Gruha Lakshmi. The Karnataka government has never, anywhere said that only Muslim women would be selected as beneficiaries under the Gruha Lakshmi scheme. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Rahul Gandhi said during his European tour that 'Hindus are destroying the country'.
fact: When a person asked Rahul Gandhi about the rise of Hindu nationalism at a meeting at Sciences PO University in Paris, Rahul criticized the BJP, not Hindus. Therefore, this post is misleading.

claim: Aaj Tak news anchor Chitra Tripathi said on her show that the INDIA alliance has more public support than NDA in the 2024 elections.
fact: This is an edited video. This is a video edited by putting the audio from a video made by News 24 channel about a survey they conducted on who would win in the 2024 elections between NDA and INDIA alliances, over a clip from Aaj Tak news anchor Chitra Tripathi's show Dangal on the Indian National Congress YouTube channel. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Photo of the ACB court judge who gave the verdict remanding former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu for 14 days in the Skill Development case.
fact: The person in the currently viral photo is K. Sridevi, who is serving as the Srikakulam-I Additional District and Sessions Judge, not the ACB judge Hima Bindu who gave the verdict in Chandrababu's case. Moreover, there is no truth in the news that judge Hima Bindu was appointed as Dean of the Law College by the Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: The government provides business loans up to 5 crores through the CGTMSE scheme without any collateral, with the government itself acting as guarantor.
fact: Business loans up to 5 crores are being provided under CGTMSE with government guarantee. However, banks examine applications and provide loans only to commercially viable proposals. Also, the guarantee provided by the government varies based on the loan value. Additionally, a certain fee must be paid annually for this guarantee. Therefore, the information provided through the post is incomplete.

claim: Traffic challans can be settled in the Lok Adalat to be held on September 9 by generating a token on the NALSA website.
fact: NALSA has not provided any tokens for settlement of traffic challans in the Lok Adalats to be held nationwide. NALSA communicated this through a notice. Moreover, there is no information that traffic challan settlement will be included in these Lok Adalats. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Recent scene of tribal women receiving treatment without proper facilities at Kothvalasa government hospital in Vizianagaram district of Andhra Pradesh state during the YSRCP government's tenure.
fact: This photo is from 2018 showing 14 students from Kothvalasa Ashram School receiving treatment at Salur Government Hospital in Vizianagaram district with drug allergy and severe fever symptoms. This incident occurred in Andhra Pradesh state when the TDP government was in power, not during the YSRCP government's tenure. Therefore, this claim is misleading.

claim: Video of Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy receiving a grand welcome at London airport.
fact: This video is from 2018 when YCP workers and fans welcomed YS Jagan at Vizag Airport. This video has nothing to do with Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy's current London visit. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: RJD leader Lalu Prasad's old comments explaining the difference between Bharat and India during the Congress regime.
fact: Lalu Prasad Yadav made these comments in an interview given to NDTV news agency before the 1999 Lok Sabha elections. In the 1999 Lok Sabha elections, Lalu Prasad Yadav's RJD party allied with the Congress party and contested together. In the full video of this interview, Lalu Prasad Yadav made several comments supporting Sonia Gandhi and stating that his goal was to defeat the BJP in the 1999 Lok Sabha elections. The Congress party was not in power in the country at the time this interview took place. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: As a result of Udayanidhi Stalin's comments on Sanatana Dharma, shares of Sun TV Network belonging to his family fell by 11% in a single day.
fact: There were no major changes in Sun TV share prices following Udayanidhi Stalin's comments on Sanatana Dharma. Since that day, only minor (1-2%) changes are visible in Sun TV share values on the Bombay Stock Exchange & National Stock Exchange. However, the share price drop of about eleven rupees on September 4 may have been incorrectly interpreted as an 11% drop. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a Muslim traffic police officer in West Bengal telling a biker to remove the god's sticker on his vehicle.
fact: This incident occurred in Uttar Pradesh, not West Bengal. The police officer visible in this video is named Dinesh Singh, not a Muslim as claimed. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: News articles in Andhra Prabha and NTV stating that TDP leader Rajesh Saripella is trafficking women abroad illegally.
fact: Andhra Prabha newspaper did not publish this news. This is a fake paper clipping circulating in the name of that newspaper. NTV also did not broadcast such an article. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Cooking in aluminum vessels and using aluminum foils causes diseases like Alzheimer's and headaches.
fact: Although research has shown that aluminum enters the human body through cooking in aluminum vessels, scientists have stated that this is not at a level that harms human health. If this aluminum is limited, the risk of diseases like Alzheimer's is low. The FAO, WHO, and European agency also say the same. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Eating food in a Shudra's house is like eating the excrement of the entire earth - Krishna told this to Dharmaraja in the Anusasanika Parva of Mahabharata.
fact: The actual Anusasanika Parva is a conversation between Dharmaraja and Bhishma, not between Krishna and Dharmaraja. Moreover, Krishna did not say this about eating in a Shudra's house in this parva or in the entire Bharata. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Americans recited 'Shri Rudram Stotram' in the White House in America.
fact: This is a video from the Rudram 11 event organized by the European Vedic Union in Zagreb, Croatia in 2018. No such program in the White House in America has been reported anywhere. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Photo being shared that eight Bajrang Dal workers raped a woman police constable in a moving train in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh state.
fact: Many news agencies reported that a 45-year-old woman head constable was found unconscious with multiple stab wounds in the general compartment of Saryu Express at Ayodhya Railway Junction Station. A case was registered at Ayodhya Cant police station under GRP Lucknow jurisdiction regarding this incident. Police clarified to the media that the preliminary investigation so far has confirmed that no sexual assault occurred on the woman constable. GRP Lucknow SP Pooja Yadav clarified to us that Bajrang Dal workers have no connection with this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: A woman named Swati Maliwal has been on a hunger strike in Delhi for the past eight days demanding that rapists be hanged.
fact: The person in this photo is social activist, Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) Chairperson Swati Maliwal. This is a scene from her hunger strike in 2018 in the context of rape incidents in Kathua and Unnao, demanding that the government take strict action regarding sexual violence and crimes. Therefore, this post is misleading.

claim: His daughter Purandeswari paid money to mint the recently released NTR commemorative coin and had it released through the President's hands.
fact: What was released on the occasion of NTR's birth centenary celebrations is a commemorative coin. These cannot be minted privately by paying money. They are minted only as per the proposal of the Government of India. The emblem of the Government of India, the three lions symbol, appears on these. However, souvenir coins can be minted by anyone by paying money. But these do not have the three lions symbol. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of police thrashing Muslim youth who behaved inappropriately with women walking on the road on Rakhi festival day recently in Gujarat.
fact: This video shows an incident that took place in 2015 in Surat city, Gujarat state. This video shows Surat police thrashing youth named Nadeem and Khadeem with lathis, accusing them of behaving inappropriately towards women. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: In the Pew Research survey, eight out of every ten people in the country expressed favorability towards Modi; the remaining two are Congress and Communist Party members.
fact: Of the total 2,611 Indians surveyed by Pew, eight out of ten expressed their favorability towards Prime Minister Modi, while six out of ten from the same 2,611 people expressed their favorable opinion about Rahul Gandhi, the survey clarifies. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Any chocolate we eat contains four percent cockroach waste. The FDA has also permitted this.
fact: According to the standards of the Government of India organization FSSAI, contaminants are not allowed in any chocolate ingredients in the country. Previously, when similar news about cockroach waste in chocolates came out, FSSAI denied them. However, the FDA of America acknowledges that it is difficult to control insect waste from mixing at some stage in chocolate manufacturing, and while accepting that consumers should not be harmed, it has prescribed certain standards for limited contaminants in chocolate manufacturing. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Photo of the place where Polavaram project work was carried out during the tenure of former Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu.
fact: This photo shows jade mines in Hpakant town, Kachin State, Myanmar. This photo has no connection to the Polavaram project in Andhra Pradesh state. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: India achieved progress under Modi's leadership in the last 9 years that would have taken 47 years through traditional methods - Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani
fact: Speaking at a recent business meeting, he said that due to digital changes like Aadhaar, KYC, e-KYC, Jan-Dhan accounts, and DigiLocker, India achieved growth in banking and financial inclusion sectors in nine years that would have taken 47 years through traditional methods. However, these comments are being misunderstood and attributed to Modi's nine years of rule and overall progress. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of a Muslim woman helping a Hindu woman by giving her burqa when the Hindu woman's saree got stuck in bike tires.
fact: What is shared in the post is a scripted video. The YouTube channel '3RD EYE' created this video solely for entertainment and public awareness. What is shown in this video is not a real incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: There is no facility to return from the moon, so Neil Armstrong being the first person to step on the moon is a lie told by America.
fact: There is no need for a space station on the moon's surface to return. After astronauts complete their exploration on the moon's surface, they return to the lunar module's ascent stage. This completes the process of lifting off from the moon's surface and reaching the astronauts' command module. The command module descended into the Pacific Ocean using parachutes, and ship crew came and took them. Therefore, the claim made in this video is false.

claim: The person in this video died while standing, this is the strangest death in the world.
fact: This incident took place in Kazakhstan in 2015. A man stood like a statue inside a shopping mall in a place called Almaty. He went into an unconscious state due to excessive alcohol consumption. He recovered after receiving treatment at the hospital. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Adolf Hitler invited Sanskrit grammar scholar Dandibhatla Viswanatha Sastry to Germany and had the Vedas translated.
fact: The person appearing in the photo shared in the post is renowned music composer Mayuram Viswanatha Sastry. No evidence was found that Hitler invited a person named Dandibhatla Viswanatha Sastry to Germany to manufacture weapons in World War II. Adolf Hitler did not mention anything about the Sanskrit language or a person named Dandibhatla Viswanatha Sastry anywhere in his autobiography 'Mein Kampf'. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of an article published by 'way2news' saying Mahesh Babu is joining YSR Congress Party on September 2, 2023.
fact: 'way2news' clarified that they did not publish this news. Mahesh Babu has not officially announced anywhere that he is joining YSR Congress Party. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi's ashes were taken to a place called Rampur and buried in Islamic style and a tomb was built without immersing them in the Ganges or Yamuna rivers.
fact: The majority of Gandhi's ashes were immersed at Triveni Sangam. The remaining parts were transported to various places in the country and abroad. When Raza Ali Khan, the Nawab of the then Rampur state in Uttar Pradesh, respectfully asked then Prime Minister Nehru for a portion of Gandhi's ashes, Nehru agreed. Then a tomb was built in Rampur to place these ashes in memory of Gandhi. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: A Muslim woman collector in Karnataka attended flag salutation wearing a burqa.
fact: This video is from Independence Day celebrations held this year in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir. The woman in this is Saima Parveen Lone, the Vice-Chairperson of Kishtwar district's District Development Council. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a complete circular rainbow that occurs once every 150 years, recently seen in Junagadh, Gujarat state.
fact: This video shows visuals of a circular ring naturally formed around the sun in the sky (also called sun halo). Several news agencies and social media users have been sharing on the internet since 2015 that the sun halo visuals seen in this video appeared in Pune city, Maharashtra. The video shared in the post is old and not related to Gujarat state. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The government is going to massively increase fines on vehicle drivers who violate traffic rules on roads from September 1, 2023.
fact: The information in this post saying the government has increased fines on vehicle regulations is old. These fine details are from the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act, 2019. Therefore, this post is misleading.

claim: In Brazil, there are only 250 boys for every 1000 girls.
fact: The statistic that indicates the population ratio between women and men in any country is called 'sex ratio'. According to the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), a Brazilian organization, there are 956 boys for every 1000 girls in that country, not 250. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Nehru did not agree to give stamp duty exemption for the four thousand acres of land donated by the Mysore Maharaja to ISRO.
fact: The Indian National Committee for Space Research (INCOSPAR) established by the Government of India in 1962 regarding Indian space research later transformed into ISRO in 1969. However, there is no evidence that Nehru denied stamp duty exemption for ISRO lands. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: If you vote for me, I'll give you three acres on the moon - Telangana BJP MP Bandi Sanjay
fact: Bandi Sanjay made these comments sarcastically addressing KCR. Speaking to the media about this in the context of KCR announcing their party candidates for the upcoming elections, Bandi Sanjay commented that in the coming days KCR would also promise to give three acres even on the moon. The video of Bandi Sanjay speaking to the media is being digitally morphed and shared. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: A video showing a rover, being widely circulated on social media claiming it is the first video shot by Chandrayaan-3 on the moon
fact: First, when we did a reverse image search of the visuals in the video, we found the same photo on NASA's official website. NASA's website mentions that this rover is the 'Curiosity' rover launched to Mars in 2011. The website reveals that this photo was formed by combining several photos taken between April and May 2014 by the camera on the rover's arm.

claim: Visuals of a person cutting off his finger as atonement for voting for YSRCP/BJP.
fact: Dhananjay Nananaware, a resident of Ulhasnagar, Maharashtra, cut off his finger in protest saying that political leaders were involved in his brother and brother's wife's suicide, and that police were not taking any action regarding this incident. This video is related to this incident. Dhananjay warned that he would cut off and give each of his organs to the central government and state government until authorities take action. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Satellites launched by NASA stopped while crossing the Shani Bhagwan temple in Tirunallur, Tamil Nadu.
fact: There is no scientific evidence that this happened. NASA has also never confirmed this. ISRO scientists have also clarified that there is no truth in this news. A private publishing company in Tamil Nadu first published this in their textbook. But they did not provide any evidence regarding this. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Video of top leaders of various countries congratulating Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the BRICS summit after the successful landing of Chandrayaan-3.
fact: This video of several leaders congratulating Prime Minister Narendra Modi is from the US Congress Joint Session held in America on June 23, 2023. This video has no connection to the BRICS summit or the Chandrayaan-3 landing. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Rahul Gandhi said that the word 'Bharat' is an obscene word.
fact: Rahul Gandhi did not say that 'Bharat' is an obscene word. Referring to discussions about Manipur during the no-confidence motion, questioning the Lok Sabha Speaker's decision to remove some words from his speech, Rahul Gandhi said, 'These days, Bharat Mata is an unparliamentary word'. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Visuals of leopards roaming under SVU Flyover Bridge and at Sri Venkateswara University in Tirupati.
fact: These two videos being shared regarding leopard sightings in Tirupati are old. One of them was reported in Karnataka state in April. Another video has been available on the internet since September 2020. This makes it clear that these videos are not from recent times. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: When you book a train with the 'Trip Guarantee' option through Make My Trip and it doesn't get confirmed, you get three times more money back than what you paid.
fact: Make My Trip's 3X ticket refund offer applies only to waitlisted tickets and to receive it, you have to pay some money under the name 'Trip Guarantee Premium'. In the 3X refund money, one-third is refunded through the original payment mode, while the remaining two-thirds (2X) is refunded under the name 'Travel Voucher'. Various terms and conditions apply to this 2X amount and travel vouchers. Therefore, this claim is misleading.

claim: Photo showing the marks formed when the Pragyan rover traveled on the moon.
fact: This photo is completely fictitious. ISRO has not yet released visuals related to the Pragyan rover's tire marks. When this rover travels on the moon's surface, in addition to tire marks, the Indian national emblem and ISRO logos are also imprinted there. These will not appear in the middle of tire marks as shown in the viral photo. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The government has not been paying salaries to employees working at ISRO for ten months.
fact: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) clarified through a tweet that ISRO scientists receive salaries on the last date of every month, and the social media campaign that the government is not paying salaries to ISRO employees is completely false. Heavy Engineering Corporation (HEC), which manufactured Chandrayaan-3's launch pad and other important parts, was reported by several news agencies in July 2023 that employees working at their organization have not been paid salaries for over a year. HEC is one of several public sector companies that assisted ISRO for the Chandrayaan-3 launch. It was not reported anywhere that companies from Kerala directly spent on the Chandrayaan-3 launch. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: An Indian woman living in Australia, along with her boyfriend, killed her husband by giving him ground apple seeds. Apple seeds contain a compound called amygdalin that releases cyanide.
fact: A woman from Kerala living in Australia, along with her boyfriend, killed her husband by making him drink orange juice mixed with cyanide, not ground apple seeds. As stated in the post, apple seeds contain a substance called amygdalin, which releases hydrogen cyanide when chewed or digested. However, for this cyanide to cause poisoning, one would have to eat 85 to several hundred ground seeds (depending on the type of apple). Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The secret behind Chandrayaan-3's success is the Rig Veda - ISRO Chief Somnath
fact: There are no reports that ISRO Chief Somnath said the secret to Chandrayaan-3's success is the 'Rig Veda'. However, in the past, on one occasion while speaking about Vedas and Sanskrit, he mentioned Sanskrit writings in astronomy. These comments may have been misunderstood and attributed to Chandrayaan-3's success. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Narendra Modi's image was projected on Victoria Falls in Zambia.
fact: This photo has been edited, the waterfall visible in it is Purwa Falls in Madhya Pradesh state. This photo is on the official government website of Rewa district where this waterfall is located. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Actor Prakash Raj was arrested and beaten by Bengaluru police
fact: Leaders of some Hindu organizations filed a case against Prakash Raj at Banahatti Police Station in Karnataka's Bagalkot district, alleging that a tweet posted by Prakash Raj on social media site 'X' was mocking the Chandrayaan-3 launch. However, Banahatti police have not arrested Prakash Raj so far regarding this case. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Conversation between Acharya Rajneesh and his disciple about Hindu Sanatan Dharma and protecting Hindu temples from Muslim attacks.
fact: There is no evidence of such a conversation between Rajneesh and his disciple about Hindu Sanatan Dharma and protecting Hindu temples from Muslim attacks. Moreover, his teachings are completely contrary to the claims attributed to Rajneesh in the post. All this makes it clear that what is being said in the viral post is completely fictitious. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: This way2news graphic shows news of Pawan Kalyan responding to Rajinikanth's comments at the Jailer audio function.
fact: This way2news graphic has been morphed/edited. The link (way2.co/d3k3fa) on top of this graphic belongs to a news article titled 'Batters who scored the highest score in List-A cricket'. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Muslim youth playing the national anthem with various musical instruments in a Kashmir madrasa after the abrogation of Article 370.
fact: This video has been available on the internet since 2017. Although it is unclear where this video is from, it is clear that this video has no connection to the abrogation of Article 370 in Kashmir. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of a woman tied up and thrown into drainage water for having children.
fact: What is shared in the post is a scripted video. A content creator named Ankur Jatuskarnan created this video with the intention of entertainment and raising social awareness among people. What is shown in this video is not a real incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A photo taken in a slum area when it rained is in the shape of a human face.
fact: This photo is an image created using Artificial Intelligence (AI) in a Brazilian community forum on the website called Reddit. A person posted on Twitter saying that the person who created this does not want to be identified, sharing some other photos created in the same way. Therefore, this claim is false.

claim: The central government is providing Rs 15 lakhs under the PM Kisan FPO Scheme for some farmers to start farming together.
fact: Under the PM Kisan FPO scheme, 20 or more groups with 15-20 members each are combined and considered as a Farmer Producer Organization (FPO). An FPO must have at least 300 members. The government provides a maximum of Rs. 15 lakhs as matching grant equity to each FPO formed this way. This means for an FPO to receive a maximum of 15 lakh equity, that FPO should have approximately 750 farmers. Some organizations misunderstood this and campaigned that the center gives 15 lakhs to 11 members. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of a Christian cross recently erected on Indrakeeladri in Vijayawada.
fact: The cross visible in the video belongs to 'Gunadala Mary Mata Church' located on Gunadala Hill in Vijayawada. Mother Mary has been worshipped here since 1925. The cross was erected on Gunadala Hill in 1933. It was developed as a full-fledged church in 1971. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The woman in this photo is Sumitra Devi. She retired from a sweeper job in a government office in Bihar, and her three sons who hold prominent positions in society attended her retirement ceremony.
fact: Although the story with this photo is partially true (Sumitra Devi worked as a peon/sweeper in Jharkhand, not as a sweeper in Bihar), the photo does not belong to Sumitra Devi. It shows a sweeper from British India. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of more than ten employees serving hospitality to a customer at a hotel.
fact: This is an advertisement video created by Garden Restaurant in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, for promoting their hotel. Garden Restaurant clarified to the media that they created this advertisement video to show the care their establishment provides to customers. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of YSRCP activists tying a Dalit youth to a tree and attacking him with slippers for questioning about village development.
fact: This incident was reported in June 2022 in Pendurthi Mandal, Visakha district. According to news articles that reported this incident, although there was a political angle to the incident, the police FIR states that the person was beaten with accusations of mobile phone theft. However, both people involved in this incident are Dalits. Whatever the reasons, this incident did not happen recently. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Every day in the Uttar Pradesh Assembly, the Assembly Speaker starts the session by saying Vande Mataram in Telugu. In Telugu state assemblies, neither the state anthem nor the national anthem has been sung on any day.
fact: The original language in which Vande Mataram was composed is Sanskrit, but it was written in Bengali script. This song cannot be sung in another language, as it is part of the National Symbols. In Telugu states, assembly sessions begin by singing the national anthem on the day they commence. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Congress leader Kamal Nath held a secret meeting with Muslims saying to get rid of RSS and Hindus.
fact: Kamal Nath did not say anywhere in this video to get rid of RSS and Hindus. This video is from when Madhya Pradesh state Congress leader Kamal Nath held a meeting with Muslims before the 2018 elections. Kamal Nath gave clarification about the viral video in 2018 itself, stating that he only told Muslim elders to maintain communal harmony until the elections, and warned them to be careful about BJP and RSS attempts to disrupt it. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Distribution of new ration cards in Telangana will begin from August 21, 2023.
fact: Telangana Civil Supplies Minister Gangula Kamalakar said this is false. He stated that the state government has not yet started the distribution process and asked people not to believe such false campaigns. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: An Ayurvedic doctor in Kerala has created the most expensive Ayurvedic soap worth Rs. 10,000.
fact: Several fake websites created under the name Rateera are promoting the information stated in this post in the form of articles. They are asking customers who want to buy 'Rateera Butter' soap after reading this information to provide their name and mobile number on their websites. They state that after providing details, one of their Ayurvedic experts will call and talk to you. 'Rateera Butter' soap can normally be purchased online on the official website of Rateera Ayurveda Private Limited. They are falsely sharing an old photo of a person working in an Ayurvedic pharmacy in Kerala claiming that a Kerala doctor has made a soap worth Rs. 10,000. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Jagan's photo was pasted on the walking sticks provided by TTD to devotees on Tirumala walkway instead of God's photo.
fact: This photo currently being shared was taken from Amazon website. This photo taken from Amazon website has been digitally edited and Jagan's photo has been pasted on it. Moreover, TTD started giving sticks to devotees from August 16, 2023. According to news articles related to this matter, there are no photos on these sticks. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam Executive Officer A.V. Dharma Reddy said they are thinking of closing the Tirumala walkway.
fact: After a 6-year-old child died in a leopard attack while going for Tirumala Balaji darshan recently, TTD EO A.V. Dharma Reddy said they are strengthening security arrangements on the walking path to Sri Vari darshan. Speaking about this, he mentioned the suggestions some people gave him to close the walkways to Tirumala temple before 6 AM. He told the media that they are considering these suggestions, wondering if devotees would face any inconvenience if they do this. Later, according to news articles that came on August 13, 2023, TTD announced that devotees going for Tirumala temple darshan on foot with children under 15 years will be allowed only from 5 AM to 2 PM. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The Karnataka government has decided to supply Quran to government school students and teach them Quran.
fact: There is no information/evidence that the Karnataka government has issued orders to distribute Quran to government school students or that Quran is being taught in that state's government schools. Moreover, the viral video is from Bakrid celebrations at Gyanasagar International Public School, a private school in Channarayapatna, Hassan district, Karnataka, where such programs are held for every festival regardless of religion. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: This video shows Rohingyas illegally entering India from Myanmar.
fact: These visuals show a nomadic family in Iran. This has no connection to Rohingyas. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: By 2025, India will fall below Bangladesh in poverty - World Economic Outlook conducted under the auspices of the World Bank.
fact: In the outlook released by IMF in 2020, comparing India's per capita GDP with Bangladesh, it estimated that Bangladesh's per capita GDP would surpass India's by 2025. However, based on this aspect, news is now being shared on social media that by 2025, India will fall below Bangladesh in poverty. But the government has denied this news. Also, in terms of PPP, India's per capita GDP is better than Bangladesh. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of Pakistan flags being waved in a rally organized by Rahul Gandhi in Wayanad, Kerala.
fact: What appears green in this video are flags of the Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) party, not Pakistan national flags. Rahul Gandhi organized a roadshow in Wayanad after filing election nomination for Wayanad constituency in the context of the 2019 general elections. This video shows visuals of IUML party workers waving their party flags along with Congress workers supporting Rahul Gandhi in this roadshow. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: It took the judicial panel 43 years to declare two Muslim League masterminds guilty who caused the 1980 Moradabad riots.
fact: The judicial commission formed regarding the Moradabad riots that occurred in 1980 submitted their report to the government in 1983 itself. However, in these 40 years, none of the parties that formed governments in the state - Congress, BJP, SP, and Janata Dal - disclosed this report. Therefore, it is clear that the judicial commission/judiciary is not responsible for this delay. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: The central government has made 10th pass mandatory for competing for the Sarpanch post; the Telangana government has given a green signal to this.
fact: There are no reports that the central government has recently sent proposals making 10th pass mandatory for Sarpanch candidate qualifications. There are also no reports that the Telangana government is considering setting educational qualifications for Sarpanch candidates. The Telangana government last amended the Panchayati Raj Act in 2018. This Act does not specify educational qualifications for candidates competing in Panchayat elections. Currently, the same Act is in force in the state. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Photo of a boy and girl who got into a pit in a crematorium as part of a pre-wedding shoot.
fact: This photo is from a scene in a private song video called 'Nee Pai Prema Chavade'. This is not a pre-wedding shoot. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The central government has given Rs. 86,000 crores as financial assistance to the Kaleshwaram project - Jharkhand BJP MP Nishikant Dubey
fact: The Telangana government has refuted these comments made by BJP MP Nishikant Dubey regarding the Kaleshwaram project expenditure. It clarified that the center has not allocated any funds to the Kaleshwaram project, and the Telangana state government completed the Kaleshwaram project construction relying entirely on its own funds and loans. Central ministers have clarified this same matter several times before. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Muslims behaving rudely with a Hindu person who applied tilak and came to a Muslim area, and evicting him from their area.
fact: What is shared in the post is a prank video. The YouTube channel 'PM 2 vlogs' created this video with the concept of seeing whom Muslims would support when a Muslim person fights with a Hindu person wearing a saffron shawl. The actors who created this video stated that they made this social experiment video with the intention that Hindu-Muslim differences should disappear. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Telangana government has increased the salaries of Imams & Moazams working in mosques from 9995 to 17000; the Telangana government only gives salary to Imams, not to Hindu priests.
fact: The orders recently issued by the Telangana government are only related to the number of beneficiaries receiving honorarium for Imams and Moazams, not to increase their current salary. While the Telangana government was already giving an honorarium of Rs. 5,000 per month to 9,995 Imams/Moazams, through the current orders, it will provide salaries to 7,005 more people. Including the newly added ones, the number of Imams and Moazams receiving honorarium across the state has reached 17,000. However, the Telangana government provides honorarium not only to Imams but also to Hindu priests. It recently announced increasing the amount paid to priests in temples from Rs. 6,000 to Rs. 10,000 per month. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: This photo (video) shows some Muslims attacking a Hindu woman.
fact: This video is from an incident that occurred in Bihar in 2021. In Saran district, Bihar, some men attacked a woman by touching her indecently. According to the FIR filed by police regarding this case, all the accused are Hindus. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The New York Times recently proved with evidence in a report that the Congress party is secretly receiving funds from China.
fact: The New York Times did not mention the name of the Congress party in its report, nor did it reveal that the Congress party is receiving funds from China. This report alleged that a businessman named Neville Roy Singham is taking money from the Chinese government and promoting pro-China articles in India. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Recent visuals of a king cobra roaming in Machilipatnam, Krishna district.
fact: Several news agencies published this video in August 2021 claiming it showed visuals of a 12-foot king cobra roaming in Chintaluru village, Prattipadu Mandal, East Godavari district. The video shared in the post is old and not related to Machilipatnam. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The education that enables reading a book by smelling only with the nose while blindfolded was formerly taught at Nalanda University.
fact: This process is called 'Mid-brain Activation'. This is an unscientific fraudulent process. The blindfolded person can see the object or book through the gap next to the nose. When this scene aired on the KBC show in 2021, after Indian Rationalist Association President Narendra Nayak filed a complaint, Sony TV management removed this scene from the episode. Moreover, there is no evidence that this process was taught in the ancient Nalanda University. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a Muslim killing a Hindu youth with a knife in Delhi's Sangam Vihar.
fact: Both the person who attacked in this video and the person who was attacked belong to the Muslim religion. A person named Sharukh killed Yusuf Ali by stabbing him with a knife for not returning the Rs. 3000 debt taken from him. The person who died in this video is not a Hindu. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a Hindu girl eloping with her Muslim boyfriend.
fact: What is shared in the post is a scripted video. Some young people from Bangladesh created this video to show the help friends provide when couples want to elope. It was found that the girl who acted in this video is also a Muslim woman. This video is not from India and there is no love jihad angle in this. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Muslims in India are responsible for 98% rapes, 95% robberies, 100% terrorism, 300% population growth, 800% government services usage, but they only pay 0.1% tax.
fact: There is no evidence to prove that Muslims in India are responsible for 98% rapes, 95% robberies, 100% terrorism, 300% population explosion, and 800% use of government facilities, but only pay 0.1% tax to the government. The Government of India does not release crime statistics and tax-related data based on religion. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Bhumana Karunakar Reddy himself declared Christian in his election affidavit.
fact: Bhumana Karunakar Reddy did not declare anywhere in his election affidavit that he is a Christian. Generally, a candidate does not mention their religious beliefs in the election affidavit. Karunakar Reddy's daughter Neeha Reddy's marriage took place with the son of YS Rajasekhar Reddy's brother YS Ravindra Reddy. However, since the YS family practices Christianity, this wedding took place in Christian style. But Bhumana Karunakar Reddy continues to practice Hinduism. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Through a new scheme introduced by the Bhutan government, Indian tourists can buy gold in Bhutan at almost 50% of the price.
fact: As of August 07, 2023, while 10 grams of gold in India was approximately ₹59,000, its value in Bhutan was ₹54,000 in Indian currency. Moreover, to buy this gold, one has to pay the Sustainable Development Fee charged by Bhutan and stay in government-approved hotels of that country. To import gold into India beyond the limit, one has to pay import duty along with various taxes. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: In Karnataka, Muslims attacked a bus because a Muslim woman was not given a seat on the bus.
fact: During a rally organized by some Muslims in Surat in 2019 in protest of mob lynching, they threw stones at buses on the road and vandalized them. The viral video is from this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: CM KCR admits that his government cannot waive farm loans in a single installment.
fact: CM KCR did indeed mention in his Assembly speech that the state government cannot waive agricultural loans in a single installment. However, this happened in 2019. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of RSS members hanging a woman from a tree and beating her.
fact: This incident occurred in July 2021 in Alirajpur district of Madhya Pradesh state. A 19-year-old tribal woman left her husband's house and went to her parents' home just three days after marriage, and her enraged father and cousins hung her from a tree and beat her. However, this incident has no connection with the RSS or any other political parties. Therefore, what is claimed in the post is misleading.

claim: Hateful comments made by Akbaruddin Owaisi, Zakir Naik, Maulana Syed Ahmad, and Badruddin Ajmal against Hindus.
fact: Although Akbaruddin Owaisi and Zakir Naik have made inappropriate comments about Hindus in the past, there is no evidence that they made the comments mentioned in the post. Badruddin Ajmal has denied allegations that he supports illegal Bangladeshi immigrants. When some unidentified persons previously put up posters with such comments in Uttar Pradesh, police removed them and warned that they would take strict action against those responsible for putting them up with the intention of disturbing peace. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: This video shows recent footage of Muslim refugees killing French nationals in France.
fact: This is a video from 2016. The video shows victims from a terrorist attack in Nice, France during Bastille Day celebrations. Although an Islamic State sympathizer carried out this attack, the visuals are not recent. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Footage of a Hindu youth brutally beaten to death by Muslims in Ujjain city, Madhya Pradesh state.
fact: Several news agencies reported that two Hindu youths stopped a Muslim physiotherapist woman on the road at Mirchi Nala street in Ujjain city, behaved inappropriately with her, and beat her. However, when Muslims were protesting in front of Kharakuwa police station regarding this incident, a youth made some comments related to 'Mahakali Sawari'. When that video went viral on social media, Hindu community members reached the police station and beat that youth. Muslims did not beat a Hindu youth to death in this incident as the post claims. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Footage of Muslims decorating a train going from Hyderabad to West Bengal with Dargah boards.
fact: This video shows the decoration done by passengers on a special train arranged from Hyderabad to Wadi Junction on the occasion of the 43rd annual celebration of Hazrat Khwaja Syed Mahmood Badesh Quadri Chisti Yamani at Halkatta Sharif Dargah in Kalaburagi district, Karnataka. Indian Railways also arranged special trains for Char Dham Yatra and Ganga Pushkaralu. The train in the video is not going from Hyderabad to West Bengal. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of people from Manipur questioning the all-party delegation that visited Manipur.
fact: About 21 MPs from 16 opposition parties visited Manipur state in late July 2023 to review the ground situation in the state. This video is from that visit. The woman speaking in this video belongs to the Meitei community. She tried to describe the atrocities committed by illegal immigrants from Myanmar and Kuki militants. However, the woman did not defend Modi at any point in this context; in fact, she criticized the central government and Modi. Therefore, what is said in the post is false.

claim: Students staying in hostels will now have to pay 12 percent GST on hostel rent.
fact: After the amendments made in July 2022, the Karnataka and Uttar Pradesh AAR benches recently ruled that private hostels and PGs will no longer have GST exemption and will now have to pay 12 percent GST. However, this ruling applies only to private hostels and PGs. These rulings do not mention hostels run by educational institutions anywhere. However, hostels run by educational institutions have been exempt from GST since its inception. This continues at present. However, the news currently being shared on social media is incomplete and there is a possibility that people may be misled.

claim: Under Yogi Adityanath's rule, Uttar Pradesh is a surplus budget state while under K. Chandrasekhar Rao's rule, Telangana has become a state with ₹5 lakh crore debt.
fact: It is not correct to compare Uttar Pradesh's revenue surplus figures with Telangana state's debt figures. They are two different economic measures. According to RBI statistics, Uttar Pradesh recorded a revenue deficit in 2020-21 while Telangana was a revenue deficit state in 2019-20 and 2020-21. According to 2022-23 budget estimates (excluding loans taken through corporations), Uttar Pradesh's debt is ₹7.1 lakh crore while Telangana's debt is ₹3.66 lakh crore. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: A letter from 1968 indicating that the Kuki tribes in Manipur actually came as refugees from Burma (Myanmar).
fact: This letter is about the implementation of humanitarian assistance that the Government of India would provide to Kukis who fled to Manipur during the Khadavmi Operation in 1967. Moreover, none of the letters related to this issue mentioned anywhere that all Kukis are refugees. Even before what is mentioned in the post, i.e., before the formation of Manipur state in 1972, Kukis were recognized as STs (in Assam) in 1950. Therefore, what is said in the post is false.

claim: Video being shared claiming that to use free bus services in Karnataka, one must wear a burqa, and if not wearing a burqa, one is forcibly removed from the bus.
fact: An incident recently occurred at Kamalapura bus stand in Kalaburagi district, Karnataka state where an RTC bus driver prevented a Muslim school student from boarding the bus because she was not wearing a burqa. When this driver demanded that all Muslim students wear burqas to board the bus, the Muslim student's teacher got into an argument with him and filed a police case against him. The video shared in the post shows the affected student describing the incident. This incident has nothing to do with the free bus travel scheme for women being implemented by the Congress government in Karnataka. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Under Yogi Adityanath's rule, Uttar Pradesh has become the only surplus state in the country.
fact: According to CAG reports, Uttar Pradesh has been recording revenue surplus since 2006-07. Moreover, according to RBI's latest statistics, Uttar Pradesh had a revenue deficit of ₹2,367 crores in 2020-21 while states like Odisha, Delhi, Manipur, and Assam recorded revenue surpluses. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Photo of 92-year-old Congress leader Motilal Vora bowing at the feet of 50-year-old Rahul Gandhi.
fact: The person appearing to bow at Rahul Gandhi's feet in this photo is Chhattisgarh Congress leader Tribhuwaneshwar Saran Singh Deo (TS Singh Deo), not Motilal Vora. Several news agencies reported that this photo was taken when TS Singh Deo was picking up a garland that fell from the one held by Manmohan Singh during the swearing-in ceremony after the Congress government was formed in Chhattisgarh state in December 2018. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Swami Anand Swarup Maharaj, President of Shankaracharya Parishad, caught with prostitutes in Sri Lanka.
fact: The incident in this video took place in Sri Lanka. The person in the video is not Swami Anand Swarup Maharaj, President of Shankaracharya Parishad, but a Buddhist monk named Pallegama Sumana Thero. Local news agencies also reported this news. Moreover, there are no reports of Shankaracharya Parishad President Anand Swarup Maharaj being caught in such intimate situations with girls. Therefore, what is said in the post is false.

claim: Recent footage of a man urinating on a Hanuman idol in the Shamirpet area of Hyderabad.
fact: This incident occurred in October 2018 in the Barnahal area of Mainpuri district, Uttar Pradesh. Police arrested the accused, Arjun Singh Jatav, and registered a case under various sections for deliberately hurting religious sentiments and presented him in court. The court granted him bail in this case. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Footage of RSS members brutally cutting and killing a Manipuri woman.
fact: This is an old 2020 incident video that occurred in Brazil. The video shows the murder of a 23-year-old woman named Thalia Torres de Souza. Therefore, the claim made in this post is false.

claim: Some thugs recently brutally raped and killed a 13-year-old girl near an apartment in Vizag.
fact: This incident occurred on October 5, 2021 in Aganampudi, Vizag. Police investigations revealed that a person named Naresh (28) had lured a girl (13) and sexually assaulted her for two months. However, when the girl's father searched for his daughter who was in Naresh's flat, the girl jumped from the top of the apartment out of fear. Naresh was arrested and a case was registered under various sections of IPC and POCSO Act for rape. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Recent comments made by Tamil superstar Rajinikanth praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi's leadership.
