fact: Rajinikanth has made comments on several occasions saying that Narendra Modi is a charismatic leader after Nehru and Rajiv Gandhi, and that he is not just a great leader but also a good friend. However, Rajinikanth did not recently make any comments praising Narendra Modi targeting the opposition as mentioned in the post. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photos of a farmer in Madhya Pradesh who died from electrocution as a result of wrapping his old shoes with iron wire because he couldn't afford to buy new shoes due to poverty.
fact: This photo is from an incident in Dewas district, Madhya Pradesh where a farmer died on the spot along with his two oxen due to lightning. This incident occurred in 2018. However, the photo with the iron wire wrapped around the shoe had been available on the internet even before that. These two photos have no connection. Therefore, what is said in the post is false.

claim: Footage of a Christian Kuki woman openly telling the media that they cultivate poppy (used for opium production) in the Manipur hills.
fact: The video shared in the post is clipped. In the full video, a woman named Grace Haokip told the media that poppy cultivation once occurred in the Manipur hill valleys, and the Kuki community completely stopped poppy cultivation after 2021. The woman in the video did not say that poppy cultivation is still ongoing in the Manipur hills. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The Andhra Pradesh government has decided to impose a fine of 20,000 rupees for driving while wearing earphones/headset.
fact: The Andhra Pradesh government has not brought any regulations imposing a fine of 20,000 for driving while wearing earphones/headset. The government has clarified this. When we contacted the Additional Transport Commissioner by phone about this matter, he clarified that there is no truth to this news. Therefore, what is said in the post is false.

claim: Video of people massively burning BJP flags in anger in the context of Manipur violence.
fact: This video is from January 2022 when those who did not get BJP tickets for the Manipur elections protested by burning party flags and effigies. This video has nothing to do with the current situation in Manipur. Therefore, what is said in the post is false.

claim: Photos being shared claiming that the Christian Kuki tribe of Manipur follows a strategy of putting their women naked in front of protests.
fact: The photo shared in the post shows the footage of Meira Paibi activists protesting naked in front of the Assam Rifles headquarters in Imphal city, the capital of Manipur, protesting the death of a young woman named Thangjam Manorama in Assam Rifles custody in 2004. These Meira Paibis, known as Imas and Mothers of Manipur, are women belonging to the Meitei tribe from various communities in the Imphal valley. It is not Kuki tribal women who are protesting naked in these photos. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Railway Minister announced that those above 58 years traveling on trains will have a 50 percent discount on fares and will automatically get lower berths.
fact: While it is true that there are some benefits in railway berth allocation for senior citizens, women over 45 years old, and pregnant women, the central government withdrew discounts on senior citizens' tickets in March 2020. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnav told Parliament in July 2022 that the burden on the government due to passenger concessions is unbearable and therefore extending them is not desirable. The Railway Ministry has not announced anywhere that this concession is being restored. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Just like Kashmir had Article 370, Manipur still has Article 371C in force.
fact: It is not correct to compare Article 371C in force in Manipur with Article 370. These two are very different. Article 371C only defines some special provisions in the context of Manipur state development. This article gives the President the authority to establish a committee consisting of members elected from the hill areas of the state regarding state development. Unlike Article 370, there are no provisions like special status for the state, non-implementation of central laws, and people from other states not being allowed to buy land in Article 371C. Therefore, what is said in the post is misleading.

claim: Footage of Kuki militants killing a young girl from the Hindu Meitei tribe in Manipur in ISIS style.
fact: The incident in the video occurred in 2022 in a town called Tamu in Myanmar. In June 2022, militants from the People's Defence Force (PDF) 4th Battalion in Myanmar brutally tortured and shot a young woman in Tamu town, suspecting her of spying for the Myanmar army. This video has nothing to do with the current clashes between Kuki and Meitei tribes in Manipur. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Supreme Court recently ruled handing over the management responsibilities of Ananth Padmanabha Swamy temple to the Travancore royal family.
fact: The Supreme Court announced its verdict on July 13, 2020, handing over the management responsibilities of Ananth Padmanabha Swamy temple to the Travancore royal family. The Supreme Court also ordered in its verdict to establish a committee led by the Thiruvananthapuram district judge for temple management. The Supreme Court announced this verdict in January 2020, overturning the Kerala High Court's 2011 ruling ordering the Kerala state government to establish a trust for managing Ananth Padmanabha Swamy temple. The photo shared in this post shows the emotional Travancore descendants after this verdict was announced. This verdict was not announced recently. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Footage of Muslim boys throwing stones at Hindu bungalows in Kerala and threatening them to vacate.
fact: These visuals are from August 2016. This video shows Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) activists attacking CPI(M) leaders' homes and offices in Nadapuram, Kerala. This attack occurred as retaliation for the murder of IUML activist Aslam on August 13, 2016, just two days before the attack. An attack carried out with a political angle is being shared with a religious angle. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: 'The Manipur issue is our country's internal issue, interference and responses from other countries in this matter are unnecessary' – Sachin Tendulkar
fact: There are no reports that Sachin Tendulkar made these comments regarding the Manipur violence. In fact, there are no reports that the US government said the Manipur violence is terrible/brutal. However, responding to a question about this incident after a video of two Kuki tribal girls being assaulted recently came to light, US Ambassador to India Eric Garcetti said 'this is India's internal matter and we will provide our assistance if India requests.' Therefore, what is said in the post is false.

claim: Video of children in Kashmir wearing tilak and coming to school enthusiastically after Modi abolished Article 370.
fact: Vidya Bharati organizations have been running schools under various names in many regions of the country, including Kashmir, for several decades. Most of these schools have been following Hindu traditions since then. Modi's abolition of Article 370 has nothing to do with the operation of these schools. The video currently being shared is related to the Vidya Bharati school established in 1989 in the Bhaderwah region of Kashmir. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Chandrayaan-3 captured and sent a photo of a Hindu temple built on the moon.
fact: Chandrayaan-3 has not yet reached the moon. ISRO Chairman S. Somanath informed the media that Chandrayaan-3 is planned for a soft landing on the moon on August 23, 2023, at 5:47 pm. This photo was created by editing an image of the moon taken by NASA as part of the 'Apollo 11' mission. No space research organization has announced the identification of a Hindu temple on the moon so far. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a 'Ghora' sitting in Padmasana for six years.
fact: The person in this video is Baba Prahlad Giri Ji Maharaj. He recently performed a penance called 'Panch Dhuni Tapasya', which lasted for 41 days. He is not doing yoga continuously for six years as mentioned in the viral video. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of two accused wearing RSS uniforms who were responsible for parading three Kuki women naked on the road in Manipur.
fact: The people in the viral photo are Manipur State BJP Vice President Chidanand Singh and his son Sacchinand. Police have already arrested the main accused Huirem Heera Das along with six others in connection with the incident. Chidanand Singh stated that he has no connection with this incident and will file a complaint with the police against those making false propaganda against him. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: If you cut an onion and rub it on the place where a scorpion stings, the poison will neutralize in five minutes.
fact: There is no scientific evidence to say that onion works as an antidote to scorpion venom. Generally, scorpion stings are not fatal. However, the venom of some species of scorpions can be fatal. Although onions have anti-inflammatory properties, they may not work effectively for scorpion stings. This is because when some dangerous species of scorpions sting, there is no swelling. Therefore, it is always best to consult a doctor. Hence, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Professor Lawrence E. Joseph revealed through his research that the world would stop without the Kaaba because the Earth's rotation occurs due to Tawaf and Namaz.
fact: Lawrence E. Joseph or any other person has not conducted such research. The Earth has been rotating for 450 crore years, even before humans and religion came into existence. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Nara Devansh performing Karrasamu.
fact: The original version of this video was uploaded on a martial arts-based YouTube channel called Aakarsh. The boy who appeared in this video is not Devansh; his name is Aarav. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The accused in the incident of parading two women naked in Manipur belong to the Kuki tribe, and the victims are Meitei caste women.
fact: According to official information, the accused in the incident of parading Kuki women naked in Manipur belong to the Meitei social group. The name of the main accused is Huirem Heera Das (32). Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Telangana High Court recently clarified to the state government that they will not interfere in the matter of Ganesh idol heights and will not impose any restrictions.
fact: The photo shared in the post was published by Bhagyanagar Ganesh Utsav Samithi in July 2016. The court stated that they cannot interfere in the matter of Ganesh idol heights, and suggested that devotees and Ganesh Chaturthi festival organizers should ensure that Ganesh idols do not exceed 15 feet in height, keeping in mind urban development and the environment. In the orders given regarding Ganesh immersion in 2021 and 2022, the Telangana High Court did not issue any specific rules regarding the height of Ganesh idols. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The Election Commission of India has released the schedule for the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections. According to this, elections will be held on December 07, 2023.
fact: The Election Commission of India has not yet released the official schedule for the 2023 Telangana Assembly elections. Moreover, the dates mentioned in the viral message are the dates for the 2018 Telangana State Assembly elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Those who give missed calls to the numbers 8866288662, 7766277742, 7272569933, 9977885467 will have their names included in the National Register of Citizens (NRC).
fact: In March 2023, the Union Home Ministry clarified to Parliament that the central government has not taken any decision on NRC. The BJP requested people to give a missed call to 8866288662 seeking public support for the Citizenship Amendment Act, 2019. However, 8866288662 is currently not operational. The government has not said anywhere that the names of those who give missed calls will be included in the NRC. The numbers 7766277742, 7272569933 are also not operational. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The central government provided 1197 crores for releasing free fish fry in the ponds of fisheries industrial cooperative societies in Telangana state over the last 3 years.
fact: The central government released 52.13 crores to Telangana state under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana in the last three years (2020-23). Of these, Rs. 15.58 crores in 2020-21 and Rs. 12.98 crores in 2021-22 were used to release fish fry. Meanwhile, the Telangana government supplied 34.61 crore fish fry with Rs. 296.52 crores and 19.57 crore prawn fry with Rs. 42.76 crores during the period 2014-2021. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: A popcorn vendor in Bangalore was caught red-handed mixing urine in popcorn instead of salt.
fact: Bangalore police arrested a popcorn vendor named Nawaz Pasha in June 2022 on the allegation of spitting in the cooking oil used for making popcorn. After investigation, they confirmed he did not spit and released him on station bail. The post falsely shares that he made popcorn using urine instead of salt. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Madras High Court ruled that Christians can build churches in their own homes without any permission.
fact: In a judgment given by the Madras High Court in 2018, it stated that no permission from any authority is required to hold prayers in a residential house. However, if noise pollution or any other incidents causing disturbance to the public occur during such events, the relevant department has the authority to take legal action against them. Nowhere in this judgment did the court say that a church can be built in a residential house. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of Muslims brutally attacking a Christian in Manipur and splitting his face in two.
fact: The incident in the video shared in the post occurred in Brazil. This video is not related to Manipur state, and there is no religious angle to this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: According to a United Nations report, 40 crore Indians were pushed into poverty in the last 10 years.
fact: According to the United Nations report, 41.5 crore Indians emerged from poverty during the 15-year period from 2005-06 to 2019-21. While approximately 64.5 crore people in the country were in multidimensional poverty in 2005-06, this number decreased to 37 crores by 2015-16 and 23 crores by 2019-21. According to NITI Aayog, 13.5 crore people emerged from multidimensional poverty in the last 5 years. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Photo of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's younger brother driving an auto.
fact: The person in this photo is not Narendra Modi's younger brother, but a person named Ayub from Adilabad. He worked as a driver at the Adilabad bus depot. Before that, he drove an auto. The viral photo is from the time when he was driving an auto. There is no information that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's brothers are making a living by driving autos. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Organizations like Google, NASA, BBC, and CNN have warned people to turn off electronic devices and keep them away from their bodies tonight as cosmic rays are passing close to Earth.
fact: This post has been circulating without any scientific evidence since at least 2010. No such warning has been issued anywhere on NASA, BBC, or CNN websites. The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) also clarified in 2019 that this is misinformation. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Dead bodies disappeared overnight from a cemetery in Thailand.
fact: The visuals in this viral video are from Tajikistan. This condition occurred in the cemetery in Shurkurgon village in Konibodom district of Tajikistan due to a flood that occurred in September 2019. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Screenshots of a letter released by Achhennaidu and an article published by Disha news agency regarding Pavan Kalyan's comments against volunteers and secretariat employees.
fact: Achhennaidu clarified that this letter being circulated on social media claiming he released it regarding Pavan Kalyan's comments against volunteers is fake. Similarly, Disha news agency also clarified that they did not report the article being shared claiming Pavan Kalyan commented that he would remove secretariat employees if he comes to power. Therefore, the claims made in these posts are false.

claim: While nearly 10 lakh companies shut down in the country during 9 years of central BJP rule, 23 thousand new industries were established in Telangana under BRS rule.
fact: Cancellation of registration of companies that do not comply with central government regulations is a continuous process. In this process, lakhs of companies get their registration cancelled across the country. This would include companies in Telangana as well. Similarly, new companies continue to register across the country every year. For example, 1,67,076 companies in 2021-22 and 1,55,377 companies in 2020-21 were registered across the country. These create jobs. Telangana state is also part of this. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Ajit Doval recently met with Muslim religious leaders in Delhi and discussed the Uniform Civil Code (UCC) and Sharia Criminal Code.
fact: There are no reports of Ajit Doval speaking with Muslim leaders recently about the Uniform Civil Code or applying Sharia Criminal Code to Muslims. The viral photo is from 2020 when Ajit Doval met with Muslim leaders at his residence to discuss following the Ayodhya verdict. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Photo of a bulletin reported by 'ABN Andhra Jyothi' news agency stating that Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath is suffering from cancer.
fact: The photo shared in the post is morphed. The bulletin photo reported by 'ABN Andhra Jyothi' news agency stating that Andhra Pradesh MLA and YSR Congress Party leader Kodali Nani is suffering from cancer was edited to create this photo. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: There is a scene on black stone in the British Museum in London showing ancient Egyptian king Nectanebo worshipping a Shivalingam.
fact: According to the official website of the British Museum, this carving on stone in the British Museum in London shows ancient Egyptian king Nectanebo sitting on his knees and offering bread from his hand. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Two Islamic terrorists killed famous Jain monk Acharya Kamakumar Nandini in Karnataka.
fact: Police arrested two people named Hassan Dalayat and Narayan Basappa Madi in connection with the murder of famous Jain monk Acharya Kamakumar Nandini in Karnataka. Among them, the main accused Narayan Basappa Madi was identified as A1, and Hassan Dalayat was identified as A2. One of them is Hindu while the other is Muslim. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: A study conducted by Harvard University has proven that if the Muslim population in any country crosses 16%, that country will become an Islamic country in phases within one hundred or one hundred fifty years.
fact: There is no evidence to say that Harvard University conducted such a study. The information in the viral post has been in circulation without proper verification since at least 2008. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Manipur Congress Party president wrote a letter to Rahul Gandhi blaming Congress for the ongoing riots in Manipur.
fact: The viral video is an edited version of a news article published by India Today. In the full version, it states that Manipur Patriotic Party General Secretary 'Naurem Mohen' wrote a letter to Rahul Gandhi. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of the Indian flag being thrown on the road in Kerala and vehicles being driven over it.
fact: There are no news articles about such an incident happening in Kerala. Moreover, careful examination of the video reveals that this incident occurred in Karachi, Pakistan. Searching through Google Maps reveals that the places visible in the video are from the Delhi Mercantile Society area in Karachi. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Photos of chemicals being mixed in food eaten by Hindus.
fact: The photo of the person holding biryani has been on the internet since at least 2016. The tablet photos were not actually taken in India. They are photos from when the Sri Lankan Special Task Force seized tablets banned for sale in Sri Lanka in May 2019. The biryani photo and tablet photos are not actually related. Therefore, what is being said in the post is false.

claim: Sculpture of Varaha Swamy carrying the Earth carved by Indians thousands of years ago proving that the Earth is round.
fact: The photo shared in the post is not a thousands of years old Varaha Swamy sculpture. This sculpture is carved on the walls of Imami Jagannath Temple in Balasore, Odisha. The construction of this temple started in 2009 and was completed in 2015. Renowned architect and Padma Vibhushan Raghunath Mohapatra was the chief architect of this temple. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of a tribal man being tied to a vehicle and dragged following an incident in Sidhi, Madhya Pradesh.
fact: The incident seen in the video is not recent, it happened in 2021. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of a Muslim man saying he married his own daughter as his fourth wife.
fact: Although the man in the video married the woman as his fourth wife, she is not his daughter. They are from Lahore, Pakistan, the woman in the video is his student, and they fell in love and got married. They clarified these same facts in several interviews. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Pope John Paul II's body being exhumed recently after 12 years.
fact: This video shows a wax effigy of Pope John Paul II displayed in Mexico in 2011. The video shared in the post is old and what is visible in this video is not Pope John Paul II's body, but a wax effigy. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a crowd of Muslims harassing and disappearing young Hindu women.
fact: The visuals in this video are from an incident that occurred in Lahore, Pakistan. When this same video went viral on social media last year, Punjab state police in Pakistan clarified that this is from an old incident. On August 14, 2021, during Pakistan Independence Day celebrations at Minar-e-Pakistan in Lahore, TikTok celebrity Ayesha Akram who came there was harassed by hundreds of people present there. The visuals in the viral video are likely from this incident.

claim: A huge mace belonging to Hanuman excavated in Sri Lanka.
fact: This mace is enshrined in the 'Pitr Parvat' temple in Indore, India. It was not excavated in Sri Lanka. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of a tweet by Nara Brahmani condemning the posting of morphed photos of Y.S.Bharati on social media.
fact: The photo shared in the post is morphed. Nara Brahmani did not make any tweet recently regarding Y.S.Bharati's morphed photos or criticizing Telugu Desam social media cell. 99 TV also did not report this. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A research conducted in Pune has proven that chanting 'Vitthala Vitthala' can prevent heart-related diseases.
fact: According to research conducted on thirty healthy people in Pune in 2014, various health indicators like blood pressure, pulse rate, heart rate improved compared to the past for those who chanted 'Vitthala Vitthala' for 9 minutes daily for 10 days. However, this research article nowhere says that chanting 'Vitthala Vitthala' prevents heart attacks. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Andhra Pradesh government recently issued a new ordinance raising the retirement age of government employees from 62 to 65 years.
fact: Andhra Pradesh government did not issue any new ordinance recently raising the retirement age of government employees from 62 to 65 years. In January 2023, when a fake ordinance screenshot was shared on social media claiming that Andhra Pradesh government increased the retirement age of government employees by three years, Andhra Pradesh government's fact-checking wing clarified through a tweet that this news is completely false. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: 'Way2News' news article stating that Tamil actor Surya opined that Telugu Desam Party will come to power in Andhra Pradesh state in 2024.
fact: Tamil actor Surya did not comment anywhere recently that Telugu Desam Party will come to power in Andhra Pradesh state in 2024. 'Way2News' clarified that their organization did not publish this article being made viral on social media and that it is completely fake news. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of a woman eating biryani mixed with cow dung.
fact: The woman visible in the video is a social media content creator from Bengal. She creates videos for entertainment/money. However, in the viral video, the woman did not actually eat biryani mixed with cow dung. Moreover, their content is not in favor of or against any political party. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: German Minister John tweeted requesting to send Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to France to stop the riots happening in France.
fact: The person who tweeted requesting to send Yogi Adityanath to France is not a German minister, but a doctor named N John Camm. There is no minister with this name in the German cabinet. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Picture of dogs eating the body of former Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao.
fact: This photo shows a dog eating a human corpse on the banks of the Yamuna river in Agra city, Uttar Pradesh state. Former Prime Minister P.V. Narasimha Rao's funeral was conducted in 2004 in Hyderabad city, the then capital of Andhra Pradesh, present-day Telangana. It is true that dogs gathered near P.V. Narasimha Rao's half-burnt body on the night of the funeral. However, the photo shared in the post is not related to that incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: In Kerala's schools, on average there is one teacher for every ten students, while in Uttar Pradesh there is one teacher for every seventy students.
fact: According to statistics released by the Ministry of Education for 2021-22, the student-teacher ratio in Kerala is 24, while in Uttar Pradesh it is 31. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Recent visuals of Hindu temples being demolished in the state after the Congress government came to power in Karnataka.
fact: This video shows visuals of government revenue officials demolishing the Anjaneya Swamy temple in the Varadarajapuram area of Chennai city in Tamil Nadu state in January 2022, on charges that it was built encroaching on the Adyar River. The video shared in the post is old and not related to Karnataka state. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Kanchi Kamakoti Child's Trust Hospital in Chennai, Tamil Nadu state, is providing free medical care to young children.
fact: Kanchi Kamakoti Child's Trust Hospital clarified that this campaign circulating on social media about their hospital is completely false. The management of Kanchi Kamakoti Child's Trust Hospital clarified on their website that they work to provide improved treatment to young children at low cost without seeking any profit, and that they do not provide completely free treatment. The hospital near Egmore Railway Station mentioned in the post was found to be the government-run Institute of Child Health (ICH). Like all government hospitals, this hospital also provides free medical care to patients. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A screenshot purportedly showing 'ABN' news agency reporting that all gold shop owners in Bheemavaram voluntarily decided to close their shops on the occasion of Jana Sena rally.
fact: The 'ABN' news channel screenshot shared in the post is morphed. 'ABN' clarified that this screenshot being shared on social media is fake and that false propaganda is being carried out on social media in their name. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A video published by a Gujarat IPS officer revealing truths about love jihad.
fact: The person speaking in this video is Kajal Shingala, a social activist and industrialist from Gujarat state, who shared this video on her social media handles in June 2021. Kajal Shingala is not an IPS officer as mentioned in the post. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a Hindu officer strongly confronting a Muslim man who deceived a girl in the name of love.
fact: The person visible in this video is Shabnam Sheikh, a social activist from Mumbai and founder of Help Care Foundation. Shabnam Sheikh provides advice or solutions to those who come to her regarding family disputes or any other conflicts. The person confronting the man in this video is neither a Hindu officer nor a judge. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: This video is from a level crossing in India.
fact: This video is actually not from a level crossing in India, but from the Comilla railway level crossing in Bangladesh. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A Dalit Hindu woman on the run after slitting the throats of 6 Muslim youth who threatened rape in Babatpur, Varanasi.
fact: Police clarified that no such incident occurred in Varanasi and that this news is completely fabricated. These viral news clips were created by digitally combining some old news clips available on the internet. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge encouraged cow slaughter by instructing police to jail anyone who comes to protect cows on the occasion of Bakrid in Karnataka.
fact: This video is incomplete. In the full video, he ordered police to take strict action against those who harass people legally transporting cattle in the name of cow protection, and against those who take the law into their own hands. He also stated that it is the police's responsibility to catch and strictly punish those involved in illegal transportation of animals or cattle, and that police should take action to prevent outsiders from taking the law into their own hands. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a woman breaking her arm after falling in a stampede while women in Karnataka were pushing to board a bus for free bus travel.
fact: The woman in this video lost her arm when a lorry hit the bus she was traveling in. On June 18, 2023, a lorry traveling at excessive speed hit a KSRTC bus traveling from Nanjangud to T. Narasipura Town in Karnataka state. KSRTC tweeted that when this speeding lorry hit the right rear window of the bus, one woman sitting next to the window had her arm broken and another woman suffered serious injuries to her right hand. The woman did not break her arm by falling in a stampede while boarding the bus. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of Jammu National Highway 44
fact: This photo is of the Weiyuan-Wudu Expressway in Gansu Province in West China. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: While giving the National Best Actor Award to NTR in 1963, then President of India Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan said that whenever he reads the Bhagavad Gita, NTR's form appears as Krishna.
fact: Awards for actors and technicians in films began to be given only from 1968 (from films released in 1967). However, Radhakrishnan's term as President ended in 1967 itself. Moreover, no Telugu actor, including NTR, has ever won the National Best Actor Award. There is also no evidence that Radhakrishnan commented that NTR's form appears as Krishna whenever he reads the Bhagavad Gita. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: CM Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy said that if given another chance, he will give one kilo of gold and a Benz car to every house.
fact: This viral video was created by editing CM Jagan's speech at the TIDCO houses distribution program held recently in Gudivada. These words were said by CM Jagan addressing opposition leader Chandrababu Naidu. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A fire accident occurred in Jadcherla due to keeping sanitizer in the bike cover.
fact: This incident occurred in Jhunjhunu district in Rajasthan state, and while some news articles state that the causes of the fire are unknown, other news articles state that sanitizer was the cause of the fire. Although the causes cannot be stated definitively, the incident definitely did not occur in Jadcherla. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: Photo of the bridge built over the Tons River in Akbarpur Ambedkar Nagar in Uttar Pradesh during the Yogi Adityanath government's tenure.
fact: This bridge is named Nansha Bridge. It is located in Guangzhou city in China. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Muslims in Bengaluru saying not to buy any goods from Hindus at a meeting they recently held.
fact: The video shared in the post shows visuals from a meeting held in Bejariya village, Barmer district, Rajasthan state in 2019. In June 2019, one person died and three were seriously injured in a bus accident that occurred in front of a petrol pump in Gagariya village. Relatives made this speech protesting his death during the funeral of the deceased person. This video is not related to Bengaluru, Karnataka state. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Prime Minister Modi proudly declaring that we have grown to be No.1 in the world in beef exports.
fact: This clip was made by Modi in 2012 when he was Chief Minister of Gujarat, criticizing the policies being implemented by the then central government regarding the Pink Revolution (development of meat products). However, only a portion of this speech has been edited and shared as if Modi made these comments proudly now. Furthermore, examining the meat (buffalo) exports currently taking place from the country, meat (buffalo) exports from India have increased after Modi became Prime Minister. India continues to be among the top-10 countries exporting the most buffalo meat. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of CBI officials catching and beating Mohammed Sharif, who was responsible for the Odisha train accident.
fact: The same video has been circulating for at least two years, showing visuals of beating a thief caught in Mexico. The name of the person serving as in-charge of Bahanaga Bazar Station at the time of the accident is S.B. Mohanti. He was already questioned by authorities. There is no staff at that station by the name Mohammed Sharif. The CBI has not yet revealed details of the persons responsible for the accident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of a banner recently displayed by CMR Shopping Mall in Telangana/Karnataka with the goal of promoting love jihad.
fact: This photo shows a billboard displayed by CMR Shopping Mall in Telangana on the occasion of Ramadan festival in 2019. CMR Shopping Mall Telangana issued a statement in May 2019 itself, regretting the mistake that occurred due to the banner they displayed as part of the Ramadan shopping campaign, stating that they respect all religions and castes, and that they immediately removed the banners they had displayed. The photo shared in the post is old and not related to Karnataka. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: A Congress MLA raised 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans as part of Rahul Gandhi's program in Madhya Pradesh and misbehaved with police who stopped him.
fact: This incident occurred in November 2022 in Shaheen Bagh, Delhi. Police stopped former Congress MLA Asif Mohammad Khan from holding a meeting without permission. At that time, Asif misbehaved with the police. For this, Shaheen Bagh police registered a case against him and also arrested him. However, as claimed in the post, neither in the FIR filed by police nor in news articles about this incident is it mentioned anywhere that Asif raised the slogan 'Pakistan Zindabad'. If we carefully examine the audio of the video, we can understand that Asif's followers are saying Asif Khan Zindabad. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of police taking into custody a Bajrang Dal activist who was roaming around the bazaar in Mumbai wearing a burqa.
fact: This incident occurred in Lahore, Pakistan. Police arrested a man who entered the house of Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan wearing a burqa. This video has no connection to Mumbai or Bajrang Dal. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: Pictures showing visuals of Manipur state before and after the BJP came to power.
fact: The two photos shared in the post show pictures taken after the BJP government came to Manipur state. The first photo shared in the post was taken by photographer Deepanjan Ghosh in 2019. BJP has been in power in Manipur state since March 2017. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: This mess, which has the name Naidu Andhra Mess written in Kannada script on the board, serves Punjabi food.
fact: The board in the photo belongs to 'Naidu Andhra Mess' in Nalluruhalli, Bengaluru. The original version of this photo does not have 'Authentic Punjabi Food' written on it; it was digitally created through editing. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of bodies of people who died in the Odisha train accident being piled in trucks and buried in the crematorium.
fact: The video shared in the post has been shared on social media since 2021. Several websites and social media users shared this video saying it shows visuals of burying people who died due to COVID-19. Some shared this video saying it is from Africa, while others shared it saying it is from Vietnam. The video shared in the post is old and not related to the Odisha train accident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of some Muslims demolishing the Maharana Pratap statue at Chetak Circle in Udaipur and raising religious slogans.
fact: Although the incident in the video is real, it occurred about five and a half years ago. In December 2017, a migrant worker named Mohammed Afrajul was killed in Rajsamand, Rajasthan by a person named Shambulal Regar. In protest of this, some Muslims staged a protest at Chetak Circle in Udaipur. There is no evidence that the Maharana Pratap statue was demolished during this protest. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Shirdi Saibaba Sansthan Trust donated ₹35 crores to Muslims performing Haj pilgrimage. They did not give any donation to Ayodhya Ram Mandir construction.
fact: Then Trust CEO Rahul Jadhav clarified that Shirdi Saibaba Sansthan Trust did not give any donation to Haj pilgrims. He also stated that no one requested donations from them for Ayodhya Ram Mandir construction, so the trust did not make any decision on this. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video showing destruction of Hindu temples in Bangladesh.
fact: This video is related to an incident in August 2021 when some unidentified individuals attacked the Sidhi Vinayak temple in Rahim Yar Khan district of Pakistan and destroyed the idols. All news agencies reported this video at that time. Although there have been recent attacks on Hindu temples in Bangladesh, this video has no connection to Bangladesh. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Image of a Panchamukha Shivlingam displayed in the Bannibigo Museum in Vatican City, Italy.
fact: This photo shows a Panchamukha Shivlingam sculpture displayed at the Philadelphia Museum in America. This Panchamukha Shivlingam sculpture was created in the 19th century in Uttar Pradesh state in India. This Panchamukha Shivlingam does not belong to an Italian museum. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The scenes visible in the video are related to a competition held at a school in Kerala.
fact: This competition did not take place in Kerala, it happened in Sri Lanka. When we contacted the fact-checking organization Fact Crescendo Sri Lanka for details about the video, they shared the full version of the video with us. Based on the language people were speaking and the song playing in the background, they confirmed it was Sinhala language. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Photo of the road constructed connecting Gangotri, Yamunotri, Kedarnath, and Badrinath shrines as part of Char Dham.
fact: The Char Dham road project started in 2016 has not yet been completed. According to information provided by the central government, out of the 825 km length of this project, 683 km of road work has been approved. Of these, 291 km of work has been completed and 366 km is at various stages. The photo shared in the post is related to the Mumbai-Pune Expressway in the Khandala Ghat area. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Video of a Muslim driver praying Namaz in an AC bus after making all Hindu passengers stand outside.
fact: This incident occurred in Dubai. 'Dubai' is clearly written on the bus. Also, the address and other details are clearly visible on the Roads and Transport Authority website. A woman who traveled on that bus stated that the driver performed Namaz only after taking permission from all passengers. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Video of BJP MP Devji Patel dancing intimately with a woman.
fact: This is an old video of Dr. Zafar Iqbal, a prominent eye specialist in Pakistan, dancing with a woman while partying in his hospital room. This video was leaked in February 2020. After that, this same video has been circulated attributing it to political leaders of various parties in India. Jalore police confirmed through a tweet that the person visible in the video is not Devji Patel and clarified that this is a two-year-old video. On June 25, 2022, Jalore police arrested one of the accused who shared this old video attributing it to Jalore MP Devji Patel. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Karnataka Congress government has imposed a 20 kilometer limit on free bus travel for women.
fact: Under the Shakti scheme recently launched by the Karnataka government, women can travel free of charge in government buses for any distance within the state. However, regarding travel to other states, travel is free only on certain routes. On other interstate routes, only travel up to 20 km in the neighboring state is free. Travel beyond that requires payment. Some articles misunderstood this and reported that only 20 km is free in total. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of people attending a BRS meeting asking Chief Minister KCR to remove the Dharani portal.
fact: The video shared in the post is edited. At the BRS public meeting held in Manchiryal on June 9, 2023, KCR asked people whether to keep or remove the Dharani portal, and asked those who want it to remain to raise their hands. After this, many people attending the meeting raised their hands. This video was created by joining different video clips taken when KCR was speaking at the Manchiryal meeting. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The woman wearing jeans and a hoodie in the photo is Muskan Khan, the Karnataka hijab protester.
fact: This collage contains photos of two different women. While the person on the left is Muskan Khan, the photo on the right belongs to RJ Sayema. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Muslims in Hyderabad's old city threatening officials without paying electricity bills.
fact: The incident in the video occurred in Karachi, Pakistan. A person named Shahri Atour Rehman was caught stealing electricity. During that time, he threatened an official saying he would kill him if electricity to his house was disconnected. Pakistani news agencies reported this incident in 2020. This video has no connection to Hyderabad's old city. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Video of a woman throwing down a small child and harassing them by stepping on them with shoes.
fact: This incident took place in a town called Condega in Nicaragua. The woman harassing the small child in the video was identified as Uvaldrina Sayles. Police arrested her after the video went viral. News articles reported that this woman is addicted to drugs. This incident has no connection to our country. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Photo of police beating RSS activists who were caught stealing valuables from Odisha train accident victims.
fact: This photo was taken in November 2012. On November 11, 2012, when a car belonging to a BSP leader hit some bicycles in a cycle rally organized by RSS activists in Agra, RSS activists held large-scale protests demanding action against them. At that time, police lathi-charged the RSS activists. This photo has no connection to the recent Odisha train accident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of Muslim men carrying money in bags; there is no tax on money coming to mosques in our country, but tax is levied only on money coming through temples.
fact: This video is related to the Pagla Mosque in Kishoreganj, Bangladesh. These scenes were taken last month when boxes were opened to count donations related to this mosque. According to the tax laws in force in our country, the same tax policy applies to trusts of any religion. Tax exemptions also apply equally to all religious places. Personally, tax implementation/exemption for donations made by an individual/organization to any religious organization/trust also applies equally. However, only temples under government control (under the Endowments Department) pay a portion of their income to governments. Governments allocate funds from these taxes for temple maintenance. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Recent scene of traffic lights melting due to intense heat in Vijayawada.
fact: The photo shared in the post shows a traffic signal light in Milan city, Italy. In July 2022, when a scooter caught fire at the junction connecting Via Bergamo and Viale Regina Margherita streets in Milan city, the traffic signal light nearby melted due to the fire. The photo shared in the post has no connection to Vijayawada city. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a Muslim man brutally beating his Hindu wife with a stick.
fact: The incident in the video occurred in Etawah, Uttar Pradesh. A person named Shivam Yadav attacked his wife Jyoti for dowry. There is no evidence of a love-jihad angle in this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: US President Joe Biden recently tweeted insulting Rahul Gandhi.
fact: What is circulating on social media is a screenshot of a fake tweet. Joe Biden did not make any tweet insulting Rahul Gandhi. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Recent visuals of Muslims and Modi opponents destroying railway tracks and throwing cylinders and stones at moving trains.
fact: The three videos shared in these posts are old. North Eastern Railway officials recently posted a tweet about the visuals of a cylinder being thrown at a moving train. Railway officials clarified in the tweet that this video circulating on social media shows an incident that occurred in July 2022, and that the name of the accused responsible for this incident is Gangaram. The second video shared in the post has been circulating on social media at least since 2019. The last video shows protesters stopping trains in Bharatpur in 2022 during protests against the Agnipath scheme and removing nuts from railway tracks. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: The Adipurush film team has announced that Dalits are not allowed in theaters showing the film.
fact: The Adipurush film team has not made such an announcement anywhere. This is an edited poster. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Out of 80,000 prisoners in Andaman's Kalapani jail, only Savarkar wrote a petition to the British for mercy.
fact: Many people wrote petitions seeking mercy from the British during the freedom struggle. Documents related to this are available on the National Archives of India website. Sachindranath Sanyal also wrote such a petition from Andaman jail. He himself mentioned this in his autobiography. Therefore, there is no truth in the claim that only Savarkar wrote such mercy petitions. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: This video shows visuals of a bus falling into a gorge in Meghalaya.
fact: This video was taken in Indonesia when a tourist bus fell into a gorge in Gusi, Tegal, Central Java on May 7, 2023, resulting in the death of two people. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Station Master Sharif, who caused the Odisha train accident, is absconding. There is a mosque at the accident site.
fact: According to local media articles, the Bahanaga Bazar Assistant Station Master who was on duty at the time of the accident absconded. His name is 'S. B. Mahanti'. Also, the building next to the railway track at the incident site is not a mosque, it is an ISKCON temple. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: I am with the women wrestlers, I will even give up my medal if necessary-Dhoni
fact: Indian cricketer Dhoni did not make these comments supporting the protesting women wrestlers. These comments made by Indian boxer Vijender Singh in support of the wrestlers are being attributed to Dhoni and shared. Dhoni has not made any comments supporting the wrestlers so far. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: A Japanese scientist won the Nobel Prize for discovering the science behind the Ekadashi fasts performed by Hindus.
fact: Japanese scientist Yoshinori Ohsumi received the Nobel Prize in 2016 for his research on the functioning of the Autophagy process. He did not mention anywhere that he researched Hindu fasting practices. Studies say that fasting can accelerate the autophagy process. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The Central Election Commission has announced election dates for Mizoram, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Telangana states.
fact: The Central Election Commission has started the election process for Mizoram, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, and Telangana states. However, it has not yet announced the election dates. The dates mentioned in the instructions provided to state election officers regarding the end of legislative assembly terms in those states were misunderstood as election dates. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Scene of a Muslim man transporting a person's corpse covered in a bundle on his two-wheeler.
fact: This is an image taken of a person transporting a mannequin (doll) placed outside a clothing shop in Cairo city, Egypt. This photo was taken when a person named Muhammad Naser was taking the mannequin to the BG Collection store in the Makkotam area of Cairo city. What is being transported on the bike in this photo is not a person's corpse. Also, this photo is being shared incorrectly with a religious narrative. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of a bus specially launched exclusively for men in Karnataka.
fact: The viral photo is edited. The original version was taken in 2017. Mens-Only is not written anywhere on the bus. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Prime Minister Modi has announced scholarships in the names of Abdul Kalam and Vajpayee for students who passed 10th/12th.
fact: The central government is not providing any scholarships in the names of Abdul Kalam and Vajpayee for students who passed 10th/12th. The Indian Council for Cultural Relations (ICCR) provides scholarships in the names of Abdul Kalam and Vajpayee to foreigners studying in Indian universities. Perhaps these scholarships were misunderstood to be provided to 10th/12th students. But these scholarships are only for foreign students studying in Indian universities, not for Indian students. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: A video filmed when the wife of Dubai King Mohammed bin Rashid visited the Golden Temple in Tamil Nadu.
fact: This video is from 2019. The person appearing in it is Sheikha Hend Faisal Al-Qassemi, a member of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) royal family. She is not the wife of the Dubai King. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of a naked woman in Manipur beating and chasing police with a lathi.
fact: This video is not from Manipur. It was taken during the recent municipal elections in Pandit Deen Dayal Nagar in Chandauli, Uttar Pradesh. Supporters of independent candidate Sonu Kinnar gathered outside the counting center demanding a recount of votes and got into an argument with police. The viral video shows this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photos of the pitch at Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad being dried with an iron box and dryer.
fact: These photos being shared claiming that the wet pitch was dried with an iron box and dryer during the IPL final at Narendra Modi Stadium are actually from a match between India and Sri Lanka in Guwahati in January 2020. News reports state that sponges were used to dry the pitch during the IPL final at Modi Stadium. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is misleading.

claim: Photos showing Kashmir conditions during Congress and BJP rule.
fact: Both these photos actually show conditions when BJP was in power. The photo of girls throwing stones was taken during clashes between police and students in April 2017, while the other photo was taken during recent G20 meetings in Kashmir. So both photos show Kashmir conditions during BJP rule. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: The bird in this video is named Haiku, and it is an incarnation of Goddess Parvati.
fact: This is not a real bird, it is a puppet. It was created by artist Calyn McLeod. Its name is 'Cloud Antelope', not Haiku. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of large numbers of Muslims parading in London.
fact: Members of the Dawoodi Bohra Muslim community in London held a memorial gathering to commemorate those who died in a terrorist attack in London in June 2017. This photo is from that occasion. However, this photo is being misinterpreted and shared with the intention of suggesting Muslim population growth. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is misleading.

claim: The Hindu newspaper, which published about the Sengol on its front page in 1947, is now arguing that the Sengol is a myth.
fact: The article written by The Hindu examining the evidence provided by the central government regarding the history/significance of the Sengol does acknowledge that the Sengol was indeed presented to Nehru, but only notes that there is no evidence to consider this tradition as symbolic of transfer of power. Nowhere in this article does The Hindu dismiss the Sengol as a myth or question the existence of the Sengol. The Hindu's article is being distorted and shared. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of police placing a boot on wrestler Sakshi Malik's head and behaving cruelly with her.
fact: This photo shows police placing a boot on the head of a person named Ranjit Singh and taking him into custody during protests by farmers against agricultural laws in 2021, after he attacked and injured a police officer with a sword. This photo has no connection to wrestler Sakshi Malik. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photos of Hollywood star Dwayne Johnson practicing Hinduism with Rudraksha beads around his neck and saffron cloth.
fact: These photos are not real. AI artist Bhargav Valera created these photos through AI. He posted this on his social media accounts. Moreover, there are no reports that Dwayne Johnson converted to Hinduism or posed for photos in Hindu attire. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: The American government has approved a law called 'Diwali Day' declaring Diwali as a nationwide holiday.
fact: On May 15, 2023, a bill called 'Diwali Day' was introduced in the House of Representatives requesting to declare Diwali as a nationwide holiday in America. However, this bill needs to be approved by the House of Representatives, Senate, and the President. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of foreign guests who came for the G20 meeting attending Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh wearing turbans and saffron stoles.
fact: The video shared in the post does show recent visuals of G20 guests attending Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh wearing turbans and saffron stoles. However, G20 delegates also visited other places like Taj Mahal in Agra, Mughal Gardens in Srinagar, and Bara Imambara in Lucknow. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of Hindu women in Kerala beating up a Muslim man who behaved inappropriately with a Hindu woman.
fact: The incident in the video recently took place in Muriyad village in Thrissur district of Kerala state. This video shows visuals of a group of 50 women from Emperor Emmanuel Church in Muriyad attacking a person named Shaji and his family on January 5, 2023. A group of Christian women attacked Shaji alleging that he morphed and shared pictures of a woman from Emperor Emmanuel Church on the internet. The women attacking in this video are not Hindus. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar praying at a dargah after the Congress government was formed in Karnataka.
fact: The video shared in the post shows visuals from 2021 when Siddaramaiah, D.K. Shivakumar, and other Congress leaders visited the Al-Hazrat Dargah in Hanagal. This video does not show visuals after the recent formation of the Congress government in Karnataka. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The Congress party in Karnataka promised free bus travel for women before elections, but after winning imposed many conditions on this scheme.
fact: The Congress party in Karnataka promised in their election manifesto to launch a scheme called Shakti to provide free travel for women in public transport buses. Similarly, in the first cabinet meeting after winning, they approved in principle the implementation of the Gruha Jyoti, Gruha Lakshmi, Anna Bhagya, Yuvanidhi, and Shakti schemes prominently mentioned in the manifesto. However, specific plans/conditions for these schemes have not yet been formulated. The conditions mentioned in the viral post are fictional. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: After the Congress party won the recent (2023) Assembly elections, a national flag with a mosque symbol instead of the Ashoka Chakra was hoisted in Siruguppa, Karnataka.
fact: Although the place where the incident occurred is Siruguppa in Karnataka, this photo is not recent. It has been circulating on the internet since at least November 2018. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: 11 of the 19 parties that boycotted the Parliament inauguration don't have even a single MP seat.
fact: According to official statistics, each of the 20 parties (including MIM) that boycotted the Parliament inauguration has at least one MP seat combined in Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Karnataka Congress leader DK Shivakumar paid tribute at Tipu Sultan's tomb before starting his duties as Deputy CM.
fact: This photo is from 2019 when Congress leader DK Shivakumar visited Tipu Sultan's tomb. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of the Indian Army rescuing women held captive by ISIS.
fact: This video is related to a rescue operation conducted by the Women's Defence Units (YPJ) in Rojava (Northern Syria). In this operation, they rescued four women who were held captive by ISIS forces. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: American Intelligence revealed in their report that Hindus in India have awakened after thousands of years because of Narendra Modi.
fact: The American Intelligence Community did not publish any report making such comments about Narendra Modi and Hindus. The American Intelligence Community disclosed in their 'Worldwide Threat Assessment Report 2019' that if Prime Minister Narendra Modi campaigns with Hindu nationalist themes during the 2019 Indian general election campaign, religious conflicts could occur in India. However, America Intelligence did not publish any report stating that Hindus in India have awakened after thousands of years because of Narendra Modi. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: This photo shows a pile of skulls of ancient Hindus killed and discarded in the Hindu Kush mountain range.
fact: This photo was taken in 1892 at Michigan Carbon Works in Detroit, America. What is visible in it are bison (buffalo) skulls. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Leaders from various countries ignored Modi while taking a group photo at the G7 summit in Japan.
fact: In the full video of this event, Prime Minister Modi can be seen coming with French President Emmanuel Macron. Also, Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida shook hands and spoke with him. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: The Congress party, which won the recent elections in Karnataka, announced that according to their pre-election promise, they will provide petrol at Rs. 60, diesel at Rs. 40, and gas at Rs. 450 in the state.
fact: The Congress party, which formed the government in Karnataka, has not made any announcement so far about reducing petrol/diesel/gas cylinder prices. Currently, fuel prices in Karnataka remain the same as before. In fact, the Congress party did not mention in their election manifesto that they would reduce fuel prices if they came to power. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: The UK banned 'The Kerala Story' movie after the country's cinema regulatory body BBFC declared it as inciting hatred.
fact: The release of 'The Kerala Story' movie in the UK was stopped at the last minute due to lack of age certification. After BBFC gave the movie an 18 rating a week later, the movie was released on May 19. The temporary stoppage of the movie release is being misinterpreted and propagated as if it was banned. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a mobile phone exploding due to passing gas.
fact: The video shared in the post shows an incident that took place at Tambo International Airport in South Africa in 2020. This video shows visuals of a person taking off his pants and moving away from the flames to save himself when the power bank he had in his pocket exploded at Tambo International Airport in South Africa. It is true that methane and hydrogen gases in flatulence produced by bacteria are flammable. However, the accident in the video was not caused by human flatulence. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Regarding the incident of burning copies of the Constitution in Delhi, the Supreme Court declared a person named Deepak Gaud as a traitor and cancelled his Indian citizenship.
fact: In 2018, various organizations protested at Parliament Street in Delhi against amendments made by the central government to the SC/ST Atrocities Act. During this, some people attempted to burn copies of the Constitution. Police registered a case regarding this incident and arrested several people. However, currently this case is under trial in Delhi Sessions Court (Court No. 765). Currently, no court has given any verdict regarding this case. Some of the accused in this case have also been granted bail. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Muslim girls again going to colleges wearing hijab after Congress victory in Karnataka.
fact: The video shared in the post is old. This video shows visuals of Muslim girls entering inside a junior college in Sagar city, Shivamogga district, Karnataka state, wearing hijab among Muslim supporters during the hijab controversy in February 2022. This video does not show visuals after the recent formation of the Congress government in Karnataka. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: After 30 years, foreigners are again visiting Dal Lake in Kashmir after Modi became Prime Minister.
fact: Currently, G20 country meetings are taking place in Kashmir. The photo shared in the post was taken when foreign delegates who came for these meetings visited Dal Lake. However, foreign tourism in Jammu-Kashmir has been increasing for the past few decades. Although tourism declined somewhat in the 1990s due to frequent protests, it gradually recovered after that. News articles and official announcements regarding this are available. Also, photos of tourists visiting Dal Lake during the previous government's tenure are available. Therefore, saying that this is the first time foreign tourists are coming to Kashmir since Modi became Prime Minister is an exaggeration. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is misleading.

claim: What is visible in this photo is the Pakistani national flag.
fact: This is not Pakistan's national flag. This is just a religious flag. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Rs. 2000 note bundles seized from car tires after RBI announced the withdrawal of Rs. 2000 notes.
fact: The video shared in the post is old. This video shows visuals of Income Tax Department (IT) officials seizing Rs. 2.3 crore worth of Rs. 2000 note bundles from a car tire in Karnataka in 2019. Upon receiving information that money was being transported from Bangalore to Shivamogga during the 2019 general elections, IT officials conducted an inspection, caught the car transporting money, and seized the money hidden in the tire. Officials did not seize this money after RBI recently announced the withdrawal of Rs. 2000 notes. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of madrasas in the country training how to slit the throats of Hindus.
fact: The video shared in the post was taken in 2019 at Central Al-Hasbi madrasa in Java Timur province, Indonesia. This video shows training given at Al-Hasbi madrasa. This video is not related to madrasas in India. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of D.K. Shiva Kumar tearing up a copy of the textbooks revised by the previous Bommai government after winning the election.
fact: D.K. Shivakumar tore up a copy of the revised textbook at a meeting in June 2022 protesting the BJP government's revisions to textbooks. The currently viral video is from this occasion. However, after the election results, the Congress party has not made any comments regarding the revised textbooks so far. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is misleading.

claim: Jihad will continue until Hindus, Buddhists, Christians all die. Your tolerance, secularism cannot change our principles. Allah has not given permission for anyone except Muslims to live – Abdullah Zubair
fact: While it is true that the person in this photo is named Abdullah Zuber, there is no evidence that he made these comments. He was arrested in 2006 on charges of having connections with a terrorist organization, but a court in Kolkata acquitted him in 2014. Therefore, what is being claimed through the post is false.

claim: If 4000 Muslims were allowed to stay in Persia, after 100 years that country was declared as an Islamic state called Iran.
fact: From 651 AD when the Arab kingdom first invaded and occupied Persia, various Islamic kingdoms continued to rule Persia. Thus, religions like Zoroastrianism that existed earlier in Persia gradually disappeared and it became an Islamic state. However, Persia became an Islamic state due to the imperialist policies that existed at that time, not for any other reason. The imperial policies of that time cannot be compared with the democracy currently in place in our country. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: The Kerala Communist government is involved in the supply of drugs worth Rs. 25,000 crores seized off the Kerala coast.
fact: Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) officials, with the help of the Indian Navy, seized a large boat transporting drugs off the Kerala coast on May 13, 2023, and confiscated 2,500 kilos of narcotics. NCB officials informed the media that these narcotics, manufactured in Pakistan, were transported from Chabahar Port in Iran via a large boat. In February 2022, as part of 'Operation Samudraguptha', NCB officials seized 750 kilos of drugs that were to be supplied from Baluchistan and Afghanistan via boats off the Gujarat coast. There is no evidence that the Kerala government is involved in the transport or distribution of drugs recently seized off the Kerala coast. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of people from a social community celebrating by slaughtering a cow on a BJP flag after the Congress party won in the 2023 Karnataka Assembly elections.
fact: This incident occurred on January 30, 2022, in the Lilang area of Manipur state. As BJP did not give tickets to some leaders in the Manipur Assembly elections, followers of those leaders protested and resorted to violence. On this occasion, some people killed a cow on the BJP flag and personally abused the Manipur Chief Minister and the state BJP President. Police registered a case under various sections and arrested three people responsible. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of Muslims in Karnataka celebrating with Pakistan flags after Congress victory in the elections.
fact: This video shows Muslims celebrating during the Eid Milad-un-Nabi festival in Kudachi, Karnataka state in 2019. What the Muslims are waving in this video is not the Pakistan flag. The video shared in the post is old and not related to Karnataka elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of a Muslim man beating and killing a Hindu in India.
fact: The incident in this video occurred in the Galaha area of Sri Lanka. The local police confirmed this. Moreover, they clarified that the Muslim man who attacked was suffering from mental illness and there was no religious angle to this incident. Several Sri Lankan social media posts shared in 2021 saying that the incident in this video occurred in the Galaha area in Kandy, Sri Lanka. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: The Indian government has decided to supply solar power produced in the country to foreign countries through submarine power cables in a way that doesn't exist anywhere else in the world.
fact: Although the Indian government is making plans to export solar power/renewable energy produced in India to foreign countries through submarine power cables, this is not the first time such projects are being built. Already such projects have been built between many countries for renewable energy supply, and some more are under construction. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video of a Muslim leader giving a speech saying let's take 17,000 acres of Waqf land in Gulbarga in the context of Congress party winning in Karnataka.
fact: The person speaking in the video is Syed Habib Sarmast, Chairman of Gulbarga District Waqf Advisory Committee. He gave this speech before the Karnataka election results came. He spoke with the intention that if Muslims manage their Waqf Board properly, they don't need reservations or loans. Moreover, he also said in this speech that most of the Waqf lands have been occupied by Muslims themselves. The speech made by Habib Sarmast is being distorted and shared. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of thousands of Hindu women participating in the Shaurya Rally organized by Durga Vahini in Kerala after 'The Kerala Story' movie.
fact: The video shared in the post shows visuals of the Durga Vahini Shaurya Yatra recently held in Mavoor city, Kerala, which is true. However, Durga Vahini Shaurya Yatras have been taking place in Kerala for the past several years. In previous Durga Vahini Shaurya Yatras also, hundreds of women workers marched holding swords and sticks. This Durga Vahini Shaurya Yatra has no connection with 'The Kerala Story'. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif tweeted on May 13, 2023, congratulating the Congress party on winning the Karnataka Assembly elections. He said in it that Congress can work with SDPI to strengthen Islam's influence in Karnataka.
fact: Shehbaz Sharif did not tweet anything related to Congress victory in Karnataka or SDPI on May 13, 2023, or at any other time. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Tabassum Sheikh, who bravely stood up in the hijab controversy, stood first in the state by scoring 593/600 marks in PUC 2nd year exams.
fact: The one who stood in the hijab controversy and the one who secured first rank in PUC exams are not the same person. The girl who stood saying 'Allah-hu-Akbar' is Muskan Khan, while the one who now secured first rank in 2nd PUC is Tabassum Sheikh. They are not related to each other. Muskan Khan is studying 2nd year BCom at a Pre-University College in Mandya. Meanwhile, Tabassum Sheikh who secured first rank studied in Bangalore. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of a German bullet train traveling at a speed of 574.8 kilometers.
fact: This video was filmed in 2007 when a train named V150 from France achieved a record speed of 574.8 kilometers per hour. This train was specially built only for research. Japan's L0 (A07) train set the Guinness World Record as the fastest traveling train by traveling at 603 kilometers per hour on an experimental track in 2015. However, currently high-speed trains running in various countries are traveling at speeds of 300-380 kilometers per hour at most. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: In Karnataka election results, BJP lost 58 seats by a margin of 2 thousand votes and 41 seats by a margin of thousand votes.
fact: In Karnataka elections, only 12 seats were won by candidates with less than 2 thousand votes majority. Out of these 12 seats, BJP won 7, while Congress party won the remaining 5 seats. That means BJP lost only 5 seats by a margin of two thousand votes in this election. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Maharana Pratap was 7 feet 4 inches tall. When Maharana Pratap went to war, he would carry war equipment weighing 200 kilos with him.
fact: The management of the City Museum in Udaipur clarified that the total weight of weapons and armor used by Maharana Pratap during war would be 34.618 kilos. The museum management stated that Maharana Pratap would be approximately 5 feet 8 inches to 5 feet 10 inches tall. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Visuals of locals catching BJP leaders transporting EVMs during Karnataka elections, beating them up, and destroying the EVMs.
fact: This incident recently took place in a village called Masabinal in Vijayapur district during the Karnataka elections. When officials were transporting reserve EVMs related to elections in vehicles, villagers blocked them and destroyed the EVMs and VVPATs. Police stated that people did this after news came that EVMs were being tampered with and reported this in this article. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Telangana Congress promised in its 2018 Assembly election manifesto to provide special residential schools, hospitals, and free electricity to mosques only for Muslims.
fact: This post refers to an old news report published by 'Times Now' regarding the manifesto released by the Congress party for the 2018 Telangana Assembly elections. In the manifesto released by Telangana Congress in 2018, it promised to provide free electricity to Hindu temples along with mosques and churches. It stated that it would provide Rs. 25 lakhs as scholarship to poor Muslim students as well as economically backward students for foreign studies. Congress promised in its 2018 Telangana Assembly election manifesto to build special residential schools and hospitals in areas where Muslims and other minorities are concentrated. Congress party has not recently released any manifesto for the 2023 Telangana elections. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: When a mobile phone is completely discharged, the radioactivity coming from the phone is 1000 times more.
fact: Generally, mobile phone communication occurs between 450-2700 MHz radio frequency. This is low frequency, so experts say these waves do not cause much harm to humans. WHO, FDA, and America's National Institute of Cancer also expressed the same opinion. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Tamil actor Ajit Kumar commented that only descendants of freedom fighters have the first right over India.
fact: Ajit Kumar never said that only descendants of freedom fighters have the first right over India, or that those who worked against the country with the British before independence should remain silent or leave the country. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of Modi playing the guitar.
fact: This is not a real photo. A digital creator created it through artificial intelligence. This was mentioned in the Instagram post where the photo was shared. One photo previously created by this creator through artificial intelligence had also gone viral. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Delhi High Court stated that no evidence was found in the Delhi Excise Policy case and no scam occurred.
fact: Delhi's Rouse Avenue District Court has not made any comments on the authenticity of the Delhi Excise Policy case, the case is still in the investigation stage.
