While granting bail to Rajesh Joshi and Gautam Malhotra, the court stated that since ED did not prove the allegations made against them, the court does not consider the case against them as genuine. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: 'The Vedas say that beef can be eaten' – RSS Sarsanghchalak Mohan Bhagwat
fact: There is no evidence that Mohan Bhagwat made these comments about beef. Moreover, he previously demanded that a law banning cow slaughter should be brought throughout India, contrary to the comments attributed to him in the post. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Photo of a person with a placard around his neck saying if charity is not given, he will vote for KCR this time too.
fact: The photo shared in the post is morphed. The placard in the original photo says "Give me charity respectfully or I will vote for Jagan this time too, then you will also have to come and sit next to me and beg." Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Minister Roja commented that the day is near for Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy to go to jail.
fact: This video is digitally edited. In the original video, Minister Roja was talking to reporters and said "Chandrababu Naidu's sins have ripened, what more proof is needed that the days of going to jail are near.." In the viral video, the audio of Jagan Mohan Reddy has been edited where Minister Roja said Chandrababu Naidu in the original video. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Recently arrested DRDO senior scientist Pradeep Kurulkar bowing to Savarkar's statue at RSS headquarters in Nagpur.
fact: The Savarkar statue that Pradeep Kurulkar is bowing to is at Walwalkar Medical College & Hospital in Derwan village, not at RSS headquarters in Nagpur. On February 26, 2021, on the occasion of Savarkar's birth anniversary, Pradeep Kurulkar participated in a meeting organized there. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Visuals of a leopard attacking two women in Bollapalli in Palnadu district.
fact: The incident in the video did not happen in Palnadu. It happened in Uttarakhand in November 2022. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: 'BJP ranks fourth among the most corrupt political parties in the world' – CNN survey
fact: CNN organization did not conduct any survey regarding corrupt political parties. The viral news clip was created by digitally editing. Previously too, fake surveys circulated on social media in the names of organizations like BBC/FOX/CNN. Therefore, what is said through the post is false.

claim: Visuals of a Brahmin priest beating up lower caste youth for bathing in the Ganga river in Uttar Pradesh.
fact: This video shows a priest angrily beating tourists with a stick near the Ganga Ghat in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand state, because some tourists were drinking alcohol and desecrating the river. This incident has no caste discrimination background. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Prime Minister Modi took photos with children and birds exactly like Hitler.
fact: The photo of Hitler with children and the photo of Hitler with a bird on his hand are edited. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Rahul Gandhi gave an election promise to remove the 50% limit on reservations to provide reservations to minorities.
fact: As part of Karnataka election campaign, Rahul Gandhi said on several occasions that they would remove the 50% limit on reservations and implement reservations based on population for SC/STs and others. The Congress party also mentioned this same issue in their Karnataka election manifesto. Rahul Gandhi's comments are being distorted and shared as if he said they would remove the limit only to increase reservations for minorities. Therefore, what is said through the post is misleading.

claim: Muslims, Christians and socialists are the only enemies of this country, the country will not improve unless they are eliminated – Undavalli Arun Kumar
fact: What is shared in the post is an edited video. Referring to attacks on Muslims in the country, Undavalli Arun Kumar commented that attacks on Muslims have been taking place in many states since the partition of Pakistan, and in the book 'Bunch of Thoughts' written by Golwalkar, which BJP considers as Bhagavad Gita, it is taught that Muslims, Christians and socialists are the only enemies of the country. Undavalli Arun Kumar's comments about Golwalkar's book have been edited to create this video. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: In Meduru village in Vuyyuru mandal of Krishna district, a black stone Buddha statue was unearthed during excavations.
fact: Fact: A news article was published in Times of India about this incident as stated in the post. However, this incident happened in 2019, not now. Therefore, the claim stated in the post is misleading.

claim: Two children died after drinking milk from a bottle containing a poisonous snake. This incident happened in Quetta, Pakistan.
fact: Snake venom causes death when it enters a person's bloodstream. This happens through snake bites. As stated in the post, venom can enter the bloodstream by drinking snake venom or drinking substances from a bottle containing a snake. This can happen if there are ulcers or wounds in the stomach. So, drinking snake venom is not that safe. Aside from this, there is no evidence that such an incident occurred and two children died in Quetta. Moreover, there have been posts on social media since 2015 saying this same incident happened in India. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: A man in Saudi Arabia married a student, teacher, supervisor, and principal all from the same school.
fact: The photo shared in this post is from a 2016 fashion show related to wedding designs, featuring Ameen Al-Ghobashi, a Jordanian man, posing with his wife and three models. Dr. Kholoud, Ameen's wife, clarified to the media that her husband Ameen did not marry anyone else, and the three girls who posed with him in the photo were models who participated in the fashion show. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of a Muslim man killing a Hindu girl and putting her in a suitcase.
fact: This video is from an incident that occurred in Gurugram, Haryana in October 2022. The accused in this incident is Hindu. A man named Rahul, who worked as a helper in a private company, fought with his wife Priyanka, killed her, packed the dead body in a suitcase, and dumped it in the bushes. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: The Election Commission of India has given an order to Adani's company, along with BEL and ECIL, for the manufacturing of 8 lakh new Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs).
fact: Several news agencies recently reported that the Election Commission of India has ordered government organizations BEL and ECIL to manufacture 8 lakh new Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) for the 2024 general elections. Union Law Minister Kiran Rijiju clarified in his Lok Sabha reply on March 17, 2023, that EVM and VVPAT machines are manufactured domestically only by BEL and ECIL organizations. There is no evidence that the Election Commission of India has entered into a contract with Adani company for the manufacturing of new EVM machines. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Prime Minister Modi's Mann Ki Baat radio program has wasted 797 crores of public money.
fact: According to a reply given by Ministry of Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur in the Rajya Sabha, from 2014 to 2021, the Mann Ki Baat program generated approximately 30 crores in revenue. According to the government's response through RTI to RTI activist Vivek Pandey, this revenue was approximately 33 crores by October 2022. Meanwhile, PIB FactCheck stated through their Twitter that the cost per episode of Mann Ki Baat is not 8.3 crores, but rather that is the total expenditure on ads for the program so far. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Rahul Gandhi will be the Prime Minister of our country in 2024 – Ratan Tata
fact: There is no evidence that Ratan Tata made these comments about Rahul Gandhi. The photo shared in the post was taken in 2012 when Rahul Gandhi organized meetings with various industrialists for Kashmir University students. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: Photo from Pakistan showing iron gates and locks installed on graves to prevent sexual assault on dead bodies of girls.
fact: This photo of a locked grave is from the cemetery at Rain Bazaar in Madannapet, Hyderabad. According to local authorities, since many people were burying bodies on old graves without permission, a person locked their grave this way to prevent others from digging up their grave. While the news about increasing necrophilia incidents in Pakistan is true, this photo has no connection to Pakistan. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.

claim: BJP MP Brij Bhushan brutally beating a young wrestler for asking for justice on behalf of a female wrestler who alleged sexual harassment.
fact: In reality, although it was Brij Bhushan Singh who hit the young man in this video, this incident is not current. This incident took place during an Under-15 National Wrestling Championship held in Ranchi in 2021. Therefore, the claim in this post is misleading.

claim: Video showing the plight of Hindu girls in Muslim-majority areas of West Bengal.
fact: The incident in this video did not occur in West Bengal at all. This incident happened in 2017 in Rampur district of Uttar Pradesh. The police also arrested the accused related to this incident. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Video of a TDP leader threatening to crucify all Christians when the Telugu Desam Party comes to power.
fact: A person running a YouTube channel called 'Rmkr Pegs' created this video based on the schemes being implemented by the YSRCP government for various communities, either in favor of YSRCP or sarcastically criticizing TDP. However, TDP criticized that YSRCP leader Manvitha Krishna Reddy deliberately created this video to incite hatred against TDP among various communities. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: The UPA government did not take any measures to rescue Indians stuck abroad during times of crisis.
fact: During the UPA government's tenure as well, many programs were undertaken to relocate Indians stuck abroad during times of crisis. For example, through a rescue operation called 'Operation Sukoon' in 2006, 1,836 Indians were relocated from Lebanon. Similarly, in 2011, the Indian government rescued approximately 16,200 Indians in Libya through 'Operation Safe Home Coming'. Therefore, the claim made in the post is misleading.

claim: Water leaking in Vande Bharat train. Loco pilot sitting with an umbrella to avoid getting wet.
fact: The incident in the photo occurred in 2017 in Jharkhand. The Railway Ministry explained this incident, stating that this was a dead (non-functioning) locomotive, and in the video you can see it being pulled by another engine from the front. The first Vande Bharat train in India was launched in 2019. Meanwhile, there was a leakage problem in the Vande Bharat train recently launched by PM Modi in Kerala. But there were no news reports about the driver operating the train holding an umbrella. Therefore, the claim being made in the post is misleading.

claim: Dhone resident Subhan inappropriately touching girls.
fact: The incident in this video occurred in 2022. The name of the person in it is Sheikh Mehboob Subhan. An FIR was also registered against him at Dhone Town Police Station for this act. Due to the case being settled in Lok Adalat, the court dismissed this case in February 2023. Therefore, the claim being made in the post is misleading.

claim: Video containing genuine views of Kailash Mansarovar.
fact: The scenes in this video have no connection to Kailash Mansarovar. Videos of various different tourist places in China are being incorrectly shared as related to Lake Mansarovar. Therefore, the claim in the post is false.

claim: In Uttar Pradesh with a population of 25 crores, liquor revenue is 40 thousand crores, while in Telangana with a population of 3.5 crores, liquor revenue is 45 thousand crores.
fact: Uttar Pradesh state relies more on liquor sales than Telangana. In the financial year 2021-22, excise revenue's share in Uttar Pradesh's own revenue sources was 22.6%, while in Telangana, excise revenue's share was only 18.3%. Among large states with the highest share of excise revenue from liquor sales in the revenue collected by state governments, Uttar Pradesh ranks first. Therefore, what is being said through the post is false.

claim: China has no future unless the BJP government falls – Telangana CPM State Secretary Tammineni Veerabhadram.
fact: The photo in this post has been edited. The photo is based on a post uploaded on 'TNews Telugu' Facebook page. In the post they uploaded, Tammineni commented that 'the country has no future unless the BJP government falls.' He made these comments at a public meeting during the Praja Poru Yatra recently held in Khammam. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of three Pakistani terrorists killed by the Indian Army, who were responsible for the deaths of five soldiers in the Poonch attack.
fact: The photo shared in the post shows the bodies of three Pakistani terrorists killed in an attack carried out by the Indian Army in Kupwara district of Jammu and Kashmir in 2015. The Indian Army is still searching for the terrorists responsible for the deaths of five soldiers in the Poonch attack. The photo shared in the post has no connection to the recent Poonch attack. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: A recent report released by PEW Research stated that the fertility rate of Muslims in India is 24 percent, and the fertility rate of Hindus is 0.24 percent.
fact: In a report released by the American PEW Research organization in February 2023, it was stated that the fertility rate of Muslims in India is 2.4, and the fertility rate of Hindus is 1.9. The NFHS 2019-21 survey report stated that in the three years before the 2019-21 survey, the fertility rate of Muslims in the country was highest at 2.36, the Hindu fertility rate was 1.94, and the fertility rate of Buddhists and Neo-Buddhists was lowest at 1.39. PEW Research organization did not reveal that the fertility rate of Muslims in India is 24 and the fertility rate of Hindus is only 0.24. Therefore, the claim made in the post is false.

claim: Photo of Kannada actors Yash and Darshan participating with Sumalatha in BJP election campaign in Mandya.
fact: This photo is from when Darshan and Yash participated in election campaigning on behalf of Sumalatha in the 2019 Mandya elections. In the 2023 Karnataka Assembly elections scheduled for next month, Sumalatha and Darshan have announced their support for BJP and have also participated in the campaign. However, there are no reports that Yash has announced his support for any party or participated in campaigning. Therefore, what is being said through the post is misleading.
